itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

660349620.name: Fish market
660349620.author: a TripAdvisor user
660349620.reviewBody:

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

657056123.name: Excellent Customer Service

657056123.reviewBody: This fish market has a lot of empty stalls but don\'t let that put you off from going to the occupied ones. itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

544910918.name: Terrific Sunday outing: go early!
544910918.author: a TripAdvisor user
544910918.reviewBody: This is our second visit to the La Cruz Fish Market, and it did not disappoint. We were staying in Bucerias and took the local bus transportation for the 10 minute trip to the market. If you are not very physically mobile, it would be better to take a taxi as there are steep hills to navigate to get down to the market and back up to the bus. But the bus was just 10 pesos per person one way, which is a good deal. Plus it is certainly a life experience! If you are renting an apartment, or someplace with a grill, it is the perfect Sunday outing to choose your favorite red snapper, or mahi mahi or shrimp. There are a number of higher-end vendors offering gourmet condiments, ice cream, salsas, clothing, art and lots of food options for lunch. Everything from Indian food to Mexican seafood to empanadas to jambalaya to chili to ribs. The later it gets the more crowded it gets, so if you aren\'t into rubbing elbows with your fellow market-goers, best to get there around 9-10am. There is only one restaurant that offers beer, wine or mixed drinks. Otherwise there is a convenience store at the edge of the market where you can buy what you\'d like. Great experience and if you are in Bucerias, it is something to put on your Sunday to-do list.

477570875.reviewBody:
You simply cannot visit Riviera Nayarit without a stop at the Sunday market at the marina! 

We visited the fish market throughout the week for great fish. Make sure you get there early to get the best selection of fresh fish. We made the mistake of getting there later one day and there way little to choose from, unless we wanted to settle for frozen - nope!

But...The Sunday market is the highlight. Great food, music, good people, beautiful artisan crafts by both locals and expats. It gets very busy so get there early. We all came home with souvenirs and fish, bread, cheese, and sweets to add to our dinner.

Picked up a present for our grandson. 464331932.reviewBody: We try to get here each time we are in the area and are always amazed at the value. \nThe tuna is our favorite and we splurge just because it is so inexpensive. 463497684.name: Best "Farmer\'s" Market
463497684.author: a TripAdvisor user
463497684.reviewBody: The La Cruz Sunday market is way more than a fish market.  Living in Sayulita we have visited many local markets and give the La Cruz market high marks on the number and quality of the folk art and crafts found here.  The booths surround the boat harbor and abound in specialty foods, drinks and baked goods.  The crafts are of the highest quality and there is an absence of trinkets and souvenir junk found elsewhere.  And yes there is a wonderful vibrant fish market with an amazing variety of local caught seafood.  Bring your cooler and take home something for dinner.\nThere is music and dancing in the center of the marketplace and I would recommend you go to the La Cruz market hungry because you will find so many scrumptious things to eat.

358458729.author: a TripAdvisor user
358458729.reviewBody:
The Fish Market in La Cruz offers fish straight off the boat seven mornings a week.  There is an amazing selection, and upon request they will fillet your fish selection and de-vein your fresh shrimp.  Each boat captain has his own section at the market, so there are multiple shops to choose from.

On Sunday mornings from late October through early May there is a Farmer
s Market and craft sales at this location.  Vendors sell food and drink, all craft items must be handmade or hand-altered so you will find many unique items.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

355448405.name: Fresh fish
355448405.author: a TripAdvisor user
355448405.reviewBody: Nice clean fish. Fresher you wouldn\'t find. Very helpful. We bought a kilo of prawns and they asked if we wanted them to peel them for us.  Who would say no to that.  We gave thhem a small tip and we were all happy.  A place everyone should visit, but, go in the morning or you are out of lu k.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

355399934.name: Flea Market Too
355399934.author: a TripAdvisor user
355399934.reviewBody: Great experience and a good Sunday morning excursion. The fish market should be your first stop if you are renting a house or can grill up some seafood. The selection of fresh fish and other seafood is incredible. The flea market and food tents were great too.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

353913450.name: Best fish market and decent flea market
353913450.author: a TripAdvisor user
353913450.reviewBody: One of the better fish market around the Bandera bay. Lots of fresh tuna, octopus, red snapper and all types of shrimp (fresh and salt water). The flea market is quiet large and has various assortment of arts and crafts and great eats. Open Sundays from 9:00 to 2:00 this is a great visit.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

351846025.name: Sunday adventure
351846025.author: a TripAdvisor user
351846025.reviewBody: I will start with this, a lot of the fun is getting there on a bus.  This was no exception, always a good time traveling.  Now my the market is pretty impressive and a really nice setting on the marina shores.  Lots of food and vendors selling their wares.  Go in morning as can be warm and plan on eating something there to get the local flavor.  On your way back to Nuevo or Puerto Vallarta you can stop at bucerias and enjoy their market too.  The la Cruz market is only open Sunday\'s.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

350051388.name: Mercado Del Mar Fish Market
350051388.author: a TripAdvisor user
350051388.reviewBody: An absolute must see. You have to go early to make sure you have the best selection. The market has different aspects, bread, cheese, vegetables anything you need. It\'s a wonderful experience.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

348340091.name: Seafood Choices Everyday
348340091.author: a TripAdvisor user
348340091.reviewBody: There are Seafood venders at the market everyday we have gone.  We have bought shrimp from medium to large, tuna, and snapper.  There are other choices too, depends on the catch of the day, and they also have some frozen fish.  We have not had a bad meal from our purchases and will really miss this, when we go back home.  The prices are VERY reasonable.  \nThere is also the Sunday market that includes all sorts of craft and other food venders.  It is a great community event and there is also life music too.  One can easily spend several hours browsing the art booths, eating and listening to the music.  This is all done in the wonderful setting of overlooking the marina and bay.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

348249780.name: Worth the trip!
348249780.author: a TripAdvisor user
348249780.reviewBody: The market only runs on Sundays from 10-2 but has a LOT of options available. There are things to buy both of the tourist and local variety and plenty of food options. I would recommend this to anyone staying in the area either at an all-inclusive or at a rental property!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

345644855.name: Fantastic seafood and market is a must see
345644855.author: a TripAdvisor user
345644855.reviewBody: Fresh ahi, mahi mahi and prawns. This is an artisan market with fresh fruits veggies and much more. We bought a cool wood puzzle for the grandkids and picked up fresh fish, pasta, breads for our stay. The market is right at the marina so a great setting to enjoy. High quality venders. Sunday market. Easy local bus ride to La Cruz! A must visit if your in Nuevo Vallarta!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

345493433.name: Small but very local vendors
345493433.author: a TripAdvisor user
345493433.reviewBody: Located on the ocean bank of La Cruz, very small with vendors lined up on either side of the pier or pont island, close to the fresh fish market 15 minutes from Bucerias.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

343408809.name: Great outing
343408809.author: a TripAdvisor user
343408809.reviewBody: The La Cruz market on Sunday\'s is a great experience. Just get the ATM bus a Walmart by the Marina. Cost 34 Pesos for two and get ready for the time of your life.Never been on a bus so packed. The market itself is a buyers dream from fresh fish to Nanaimo bars. All kinds of artisans and food vendors. From what I understand is there are no resellers allowed. IE nothing from China. Spent four hours and didn\'t get to see it all. BUT be ready for the crowd, it is super popular.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

342801633.name: Large market, good stuff
342801633.author: a TripAdvisor user
342801633.reviewBody: Took the bus down from Sayulita and then caught a taxi down into the market. We bought some excellent tuna at the fish market. And then walked through the rest of the market looking at the hundreds of different booths.\n\n The average age of people there seem to be more of the retired variety. If you don\'t mind bumping into people (as in super crowded gapers not paying attention to where they are going) at the typical farmers market you will like this place. Plus it\'s a pretty setting.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

342019683.name: Artisian market
342019683.author: a TripAdvisor user
342019683.reviewBody: We recently went to the market on Sunday, which is the day for the artisan market. The booths sell hand made crafts which are really worth the trip. We travelled from Nuevo Vallarta and one of the best parts of the trip..if you are in the area, go on Sunday and enjoy the experience.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

317099948.name: My Agape Seaside Orginal Clothing
317099948.author: a TripAdvisor user
317099948.reviewBody: When traveling it is best when you can enjoy the great outdoors, food and scenery all together.  This LaCruz Market offers the best in all aspects and since I love seafood, friends and live close by this is truly an adventure.  Looking forward to sharing our new clothing line with many extras to take home as a remembrance to such an awesome experience.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

310365935.name: As Fresh as it Gets
310365935.author: a TripAdvisor user
310365935.reviewBody: Getting up early in the morning to vist and buy the most fresh catch of the day Is a magnificent experience. You will find for the best price high quality of fish and sea food with great service and recomendations to prepare Ceviches, Shrimp Cocktails, Tuna tartare, and everything you can imagine.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

289976114.name: Get it fresh
289976114.author: a TripAdvisor user
289976114.reviewBody:
We live just around the corner and the great thing is walking to pick up a kilo of fresh tuna for 180 pesos (less than $15 Cdn.). A kilo, not a pound! 
Lots of other fresh fish as well. Shrimp, marlin, dorado etc.
Watch where the locals are buying and you'll get an idea whose got the best fish that day. Restaurants buy here. 
In the high season, they have the artists market to walk through.
Nice to walk around the "boardwalk" and see the marina, the ocean and the beach just feet away.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

289297820.name: Authentic Fresh Fish Market
289297820.author: a TripAdvisor user
289297820.reviewBody: A terrific fresh fish market. The local fisherman cooperative sells fish caught in the bay. My wife and I consider this to be the best place to buy fish directly from the fisherman. They will cut up the fish any way you want them to. They will also offer suggestions on how to cook it.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

285054054.name: 6 weeks in Heaven
285054054.author: a TripAdvisor user
285054054.reviewBody: Spent 6 weeks in La Cruz and found the people were very nice and friendly. We used the local buses as we did not get a car and found them very inexpensive. The fish market in the town is fantastic with a range of fresh seafood. 1 kilo of prawns or shrimp cost only $12 and were delicious. Getting to and from Puerto Vallarta took about 1 hour each way and the cost was about $6 for both of us and we did not see one chicken on the buses lol. Highly recommend this place.\nUse google to see this place.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

279134218.name: Plenty of fresh fish to buy.
279134218.author: a TripAdvisor user
279134218.reviewBody: If you like walking through many fresh fish stands with catch that has just been brought in by the many captains, then this is the place to go.  This is the one place in the area where you can jumbo prawns on ice, freshly caught.  Also there\'s fresh tuna, bonita, mahi mahi, and several other types of fish to buy.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

269378135.name: Way More than a fish market
269378135.author: a TripAdvisor user
269378135.reviewBody: On Sundays there is a Farmers/Artisan market by the marina in La Cruz de Huanacaxtle.  This is all high quality vendors and while the  fish is great is is maybe 5% of the total market.  Organic fruits, veggies, breads, treats and lots of quality craftsman - not a flea market  - we got fish, organic berries, yogurt - great stuff and a surprise.  Lots of foreigners at the market-

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

263493158.name: Interesting, but predominantly foreigners selling to foreigners
263493158.author: a TripAdvisor user
263493158.reviewBody: This market is an interesting sight to see.  However, if you are looking to support local artisans, you will be disappointed.  Most of the booths are rented by foreigners that live in the area.  That\'s not to say you won\'t find some cool crafts, good food and interesting people.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

261487087.name: Great Mahi mahi!!!
261487087.author: a TripAdvisor user
261487087.reviewBody: We live about 5 minutes away from the Fish Market.  We avoid the area on Sunday as it is so busy.  We buy shrimp (they will shell and devein for a small fee) and mahi mahi on a regular basis.  Always excellent!!!! Always fare prices!!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

261359371.name: Sunday Market
261359371.author: a TripAdvisor user
261359371.reviewBody: If you are in the L Cruz or Bucerias area on a Sunday take in the market. But go on an empty stomach. Great artisan vendors selling everything from custom quality jewelry to eco coffee roasters to an outstanding selection of food vendors. There are a lot of expats tryng to carve out cottage industries. Overall great sunday morning experience.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

257561510.name: La Cruz Fish Market unique experience
257561510.author: a TripAdvisor user
257561510.reviewBody: Great experience. Starts with the fish market as the boats bring in their catch. Only wish we were prepared to buy some. There was red snapper, sea bass, and many I did not know.  Shrimp in several sizes some had to be 4 oz or more each. Marina full of boats from dingy fishing boats, to large fishing boats to million dollar yachts. There is a large contingent of arts and crafts vendors, food vendors, jewelry, hats, saddles, outdoor wind decorations and so much more. Overall good experience.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

257557276.name: Amazing Sunday market!
257557276.author: a TripAdvisor user
257557276.reviewBody: If you are looking for handmade souvenirs, fresh food, fresh flowers, fresh produce, jewelry, clothes and more do not miss the Sunday market in La Cruz.  We are so happy some locals told us about this place.  We arrived to a bustling market alongside the water in La Cruz.  It was very busy and crowded, but we scoured our way in and out of the aisles and found some good stuff!  I had the best homemade rice pudding ever and found some neat stuff souvenirs to bring home too.  Interesting food items for sale and fresh fish too.  I loved looking at the boats in the marina, so colorful.  Definitely a must do when on vacation in the area!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

253905226.name: Best seafood
253905226.author: a TripAdvisor user
253905226.reviewBody: Nothing like buying fresh shrimp or tuna right off the boats. That\'s what one gets at the LaCruz marina market. Product is fresh, prices reasonable and the workers at the market are very helpful. If you love seafood this is a wonderful and tastey experience.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

252662831.name: Sunday Market
252662831.author: a TripAdvisor user
252662831.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the opportunity to attend the Sunday Market at the Fish Market.  Lots and lots \nof vendors with organic produce, pre made meals (me), jams, jellies, food food food, coffee\njewellery, blankets etc etc. Fabulous day of shopping

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

247885721.name: one great fish market
247885721.author: a TripAdvisor user
247885721.reviewBody: What can you say about a fish market? This is fresh fish. The boats come in in the morning and the fish could not be fresher. The fish mongers have all the different fish on ice and the prices are wonderful. I wish I had a picture because there are fish of all size and colors. If your in La Cruz, hit the fish market.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

243203940.name: FRESH!
243203940.author: a TripAdvisor user
243203940.reviewBody: It can\'t get any fresher than the Mercado del Mar in La Cruz!  This is our weekly stop for the freshest seafood!  We like the vendor who is oceanside on the front of the market on the right as you\'re looking at the marina.  Guillermo has introduced us to some varieties that we had never tried!  Parrot Fish being one, which has become a favorite!  Some of the other offerings are Yellow Fin Tuna, Dorado, Grouper, Langostinos, and shrimp.  Helpful and somewhat able to speak English.  The prices are incredibly fair!  Don\'t forget to tip your fish monger!  You may ask for some of the bloodlines etc which they remove, if you have a special Kitty at home!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

239586455.name: La Cruz is a Fun Day!
239586455.author: a TripAdvisor user
239586455.reviewBody: The Fish Market is located in the Marina and is very interesting to see the "daily catch". Starting in November there is a Farmer\'s Market on Sunday from around 9:00 to 2:00 (Mexican time!) From the Nuevo Vallarta area we took a 15 min cab to the Marina and a bus back to Bucerias then walked the beach to our hotel. The Farmers Market is filled with wonderful food and other items for sale. There was music and because it was the Day of the Dead Holiday, there were people dressed as skeletons on stilts. It was a great day.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

215397637.name: best fish and seafood in town
215397637.author: a TripAdvisor user
215397637.reviewBody:
now remember, they don't cook it here, this is a fish market so you go and buy and cook your own food at your condo, apt or hotel. but I can tell you this, go there 7am and you will see the pangas coming in with the catch of the night it does not get any fresher than this, every day fish is fresh off the sea.

and prices are unbeatable too! where can you buy 1lb of mahi mahi for $4USD???

it's also nice to see the fisherman and salesman doing their job, if you're lucky, they caught a tuna, and you can get some free sashimi right there! I've done that my self already!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

213078892.name: LOVE the La Cruz fish market!
213078892.author: a TripAdvisor user
213078892.reviewBody: On any given day I\'m at the market... Tuna is fabulous, fresh and cheap! Red snapper (Huachinango) is my favourites that my hubby and guests adore wrapped in banana leaves and slow cooked. Shrimp by the kilo and lots and lots of new fish to experiment. AND they cut up scraps for my kittties!! All a 5 minute walk down the beach! One of the best parts of living where we do!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

212163026.name: Fresh fresh fresh seafood!
212163026.author: a TripAdvisor user
212163026.reviewBody: My family travels to Real del Mar frequently and found that the fish market in La Cruz is a must if you want to grill the best seafood. We have gotten fresh shrimp, red snapper, tuna, and red fish and all was so delicious. The tuna this past trip was grilled to perfection and tasted like steak. This is coming from a person who never orders tuna. So if you are there, go before 9 in the summer and before 10 in the spring and fall.  Then walk down and buy fresh tortillas. What a feast. Enjoy!

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

203715748.name: Freshest Fish Around
203715748.author: a TripAdvisor user
203715748.reviewBody: Took a taxi here to purchase our fish for dinner that night. Fish was very fresh and delicious. We thought there were other things in the area, but there wasn\'t. We were looking for some shops. There are a few restaurants, but we didn\'t eat there.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

194048012.name: Over commercialised
194048012.author: a TripAdvisor user
194048012.reviewBody: the fish is great - you\'ll never find anything fresher. Go early - 9.30 at the latest - if you want to miss the hoards of tourists. Other than the fish most of the things being sold are overpriced touristy things.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

193379269.name: Great market
193379269.author: a TripAdvisor user
193379269.reviewBody: This is likely the cleanest place in town.  Lots of choices, at reasonable prices.  You\'ll shop better here than any nearby carniceria.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

189904818.name: Only place to buy fresh fish
189904818.author: a TripAdvisor user
189904818.reviewBody:
This market is fabulous, the fish are all caught in local waters and it is the only place to buy fresh fish. I have buying the fish for my restaurant daily for two years now and my clients can all notice the difference in what is truly fresh as opposed to restaurants that purchase from distributors. 
I disagree with the local reviewer who states the market is not clean also in their wishing there were more varieties. There are always over 20 different types of fish alone, at times they do not have certain types of fish but through no fault of their own. If the fish like Yellow Fin Tuna for example are not running the fisherman will bring in other types. 
It is kind of sad that a local restaurant owner would give a negative review to the fish market which allows them to drive less than one mile to purchase the freshest fish for the best price. Restaurants that are further away most all go through distributors and offer fish which have been on ice and in coolers for days. Granted the fish are still of a high quality and around the world this is how restaurants operate but it is not the same as caught in the early morning and served the same day.  
For the restaurants who do take advantage of the fresh fish market their catch of the day was actually caught that day, and what a difference a day makes.
Kent Eva’s Brickhouse Restaurant

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

188844459.name: EXCELLANT MARKET
188844459.author: a TripAdvisor user
188844459.reviewBody: THis is a great market. Large choice of shrimp sizes available. For an extra 20 pesos get your shrimp shelled and deveined. On weekends there is produce, crafts and baked goods on sale. Bring a cooler, and go early, parking can be an issue.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

185808648.name: Fish Market declines
185808648.author: a TripAdvisor user
185808648.reviewBody: We live in La Cruz and we love to have fresh fish, which you certainly can get at the La Cruz Fish Market. However we would prefer a bigger variety and the cleanlyness lets a lot to be desired.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

158316439.name: Fish market is great
158316439.author: a TripAdvisor user
158316439.reviewBody: We rented in LaCruz for 4 months. The fish market and the Sunday market is great. However....we will not be renting in La Cruz again. The town is very noisy, dirty with dog crap everywhere. There are many fabulous restaurants in the area, but they are expensive. Not much to do, so we are looking to rent in Bucerias.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

148426683.name: Lots of fish but market is better
148426683.author: a TripAdvisor user
148426683.reviewBody: We took a bus from  Puerto vallarta to la Cruz.  It took about 1 1/2 hr to get there and 1 hr to get back.  Ask the driver where to get off as we missed it and had to take the bus back.  The fish market is interesting but the open air market is great. Over 200 vendors. Very good quality and lots of local food.  Thus market is only open Sundays.  Go early as it gets very busy.  Be there for lunch as lots of good food. Yes it was worth the Mexican bus trip.

itemReviewed.name: La Cruz de Huanacaxle Fish Market

674018307.name: Manzanilla Beach
674018307.author: a TripAdvisor user
674018307.reviewBody: This is a pretty good beach with almost no waves to the far right near the rocks. The water is pretty clean, and just the right temperature. It is a really good place for swimming...My only compliant would be that it is over-crowded at times...and people blast their radio pretty loud forcing you to listen to their music.

661737911.name: Beautiful beach
661737911.author: a TripAdvisor user
661737911.reviewBody: The beach sand is fine and the beach is flat. one  can walk for miles on the beach. It is also great for swimming. Most of the time, the waves are gentle, making it very safe for families.

659148426.name: Great Beach in Town
659148426.author: a TripAdvisor user
659148426.reviewBody: Playa Manzanilla is a shortish beach right in the corner of La Cruz. It has 4 beach restaurants, a fruit seller, oyster seller. Along the back road is a couple of convienence stores selling soup to nuts. And of course beer.\nThe restaurants are good.. menu plentiful and the one with colour table cloths has a English menu., waiters friendly limited English.. good for an afternoon.\nThe sea shore is protected so not very big waves.. have fun

649221712.name: Beautiful sand!
649221712.author: a TripAdvisor user
649221712.reviewBody: We walked this beach daily and enjoyed the easy pace.  One can walk from the new marina up to the end of the beach, maybe 3/4 mile.  The beach has nice sandy parts, swim zones and some rocky tidal pools.  Couple of nice restaurants, we ate at Cocos and it was good.

645507527.name: Not Impressed
645507527.author: a TripAdvisor user
645507527.reviewBody: My wife and I thought we would explore some of the local attractions between Bucerias and Punta Mita, we took the bus and were dropped off on the highway going past this beach.  We were there relatively early in the day (approx 10:30 am on a weekday), it wasn\u2019t very busy, ocean was rough that day (red flags out). There are a lot of tables/small plapas for use/rent and there seemed to be plenty of small restaurant/bars/mini supers close by for patron use.\nOur first impression was that the place is very tired, the beach sand is a bit dirty and gravely in some areas.  There\u2019s a big parking lot available if you are driving there, (I assume there would be a fee for parking), we did not stay long enough to see how the washroom facilities were, as such we were able to walk along the beach and made our way to the La Cuz Marina (maybe a 10-15 minute walk).\nIn any event, we didn\u2019t thing we would come back, just not our type of beach, and I wouldn\u2019t recommend going there to any of our friends.

641847484.name: evolucion Jewelry Store
641847484.author: a TripAdvisor user
641847484.reviewBody: Best place to buy Jewelry. good Prices, amazing designs, and helpful staff. The Church at Puerta Vallarta is amazing. Great entertainment on the Malecon

571363844.name: Super crowded!
571363844.author: a TripAdvisor user
571363844.reviewBody: We didn\'t really enjoyed our time here since it was too crowded, we left after 10 minutes. Maybe because it was Easter week but we saw some other beaches better than this one.\nA lot of local people here since the water is very calm and easy to access.

571073642.name: Very busy
571073642.author: a TripAdvisor user
571073642.reviewBody: Again, we were there the 2nd last wk in March and on the wknd, it was packed with people, umbrellas, kids and a catermaran off shore. You could sit at a table and get a beer or food. 8-9 bus loads of people here during Holy Wk. Stayed away from there. Too crowded.

570251856.name: Local Beach
570251856.author: a TripAdvisor user
570251856.reviewBody: This is a very local beach.  Good beach for small children.  Small waves even on windy day and shallow water for easy access but there are some rocks in the water so watch out for those.  There is food and vendors available for shopping.  Bathrooms for a fee.   Parking was 20 pesos in a big field.  There are tables and chairs to sit and order from a restaurant.  If you have your own umbrella and chairs the food will come to you and everything else will too.  We did a lot of shopping on this beach.  Fun day on the beach near La Cruz--you can see the La Cruz Marina from this beach.  I really like the queso pies.

288049049.name: En busca de un buen tequila!!!!
288049049.author: a TripAdvisor user
288049049.reviewBody: Un lugar donde uno puede encontrar de lo que andes buscando!! Muy buen servicio del personal. Sin duda volver\u00e9. Se los recomiendo!!

itemReviewed.name: Museo del Tequila y el Mariachi

141136891.name: Buen museo
141136891.author: a TripAdvisor user
141136891.reviewBody: Es una buena eleccion para conocer la gran variedad de tequilas que existen en nuestro pais, para mi gusto faltaron algunos como el chinaco que se elabora en gonzalez, tamaulipas pero me qude impresionada x la gran muestra que tienen, el horario: abren muy tarde para el fin de semana pero es un buen recorrido y al final degustas tequila y mezcal sin costo

itemReviewed.name: Museo del Tequila y el Mariachi

672297497.name: So much fun.
672297497.author: a TripAdvisor user
672297497.reviewBody: This market is alway fun and always find something new. Beautiful craftmanship and people. Very crowded, come and be patient.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

672165680.name: Awesome Sunday Market
672165680.author: a TripAdvisor user
672165680.reviewBody: Lots of Vendors beginning in the town square along the waterfront all the way out to the island at the end of the strolling area.  Filled with artisan crafts, treasures, souvenirs, home decor items, clothing, jewellery and sumptuous foods and fresh juices.  A great way to spend Sunday. Go early as market winds down at 2pm.  Check online for seasonal dates when market opens and closes before you go.   Located 35-40 min drive from PV downtown.  A must visit!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

671400029.name: Bigger and better than ever
671400029.author: a TripAdvisor user
671400029.reviewBody: This year\'s Sunday Market in La Cruz was the best ever. The number of stalls is greatly increased with the new expansion. But it\'s always fun to return to treasures like fresh French breads and pastries, empanadas, berries, fresh pastas and raviolis, garlicky pork roulade sandwiches, Italian sausages, fresh fish of every kind, juices and butter chicken. What variety. The local artisans are amazing and will custom-make many treasures for you. Just ask!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

669664717.name: Awesome Market!
669664717.author: a TripAdvisor user
669664717.reviewBody: So many vendors and so many different products! Good quality items and very reasonable prices. Very friendly vendors and not pushy.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

667005981.name: Spectacular Setting - Good Food
667005981.author: a TripAdvisor user
667005981.reviewBody: La Cruz de Huanacaxtle has a farmer\u2019s market at the marina and town square on Sunday morning. This is a fun place to get locally-made food and crafts. Some of the booths are manned by expats and even that is fun to hear about how they came to be in La Cruz de Huanacaxtle. The granddaughters especially liked getting freshly-made, while-they-watched, tortillas and quesadillas.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

666729759.name: Spectacular variety
666729759.author: a TripAdvisor user
666729759.reviewBody: This market has tripled in size this year. They spread out the vendors to the other side of the marina. The Pier has vendors just on one side now and makes it much easier to move around. This market specializes in things made by the seller, from crafts, clothing, art and food. It is truly an amazing variety, with something for everyone. A must see place on Sundays till the end of April.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

661934592.name: Interesting outing!
661934592.author: a TripAdvisor user
661934592.reviewBody: Our party of three spent our Sunday morning in the area at the La Cruz de Huanacaxtle Market. The location along the La Cruz waterfront is spectacular! The market has recently doubled in size with local vendors, locally made products, and excellent quality. There is live music and such a friendly energy about the place! But be prepared for baking sun later in the morning and a huge crowd. It has an interesting selection of clothing, jewellery, souvenirs, handcrafted silver jewelry, hand painted clothes, paintings from local artists, homemade salsa, jams and dips, vegetables, fresh fish and prepared food. The baking is great and we bought chocolate to take home. At one end of the Marina are public washrooms and a food stalls area.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

661923501.name: Sunday morning market in La Cruz
661923501.author: a TripAdvisor user
661923501.reviewBody: Market starts setting up at 9 am - go early!!  Park up the hill about two blocks away, otherwise there is nothing closer, no matter what the time (no parking near the fish market or very limited).  Walk down the hill and start on the east side, see all the crafts, at the end of the breakwater is the breakfast food.  Lots to choose from, just amazing variety.  No seating per se, just eat standing up.  Then head towards the food - check out the French cheese  place, the bread places, hummus, all sorts of food.  The fruit stand is excellent - raspberries, strawberries etc.  All very fresh.  If you need fish, go early too and take a cooler with ice so it stays fresh and cold.  Further down the marina, there is an excellent Mexican cheese stand.  Lots of fun, but go early and leave early. By 11 am it is a ZOO.  Note:  vendors prefer cash but some take credit or debit cards (mostly the clothing and jewellery places).

645721797.name: Sunday Market full of Delights
645721797.author: a TripAdvisor user
645721797.reviewBody:
We heard quite a bit about La Cruz Sunday market so we negotiated a 300pesos cab ride from Icon to the market at 9am. We arrived in 40 minutes and all vendors were already set up and many people were there.

The market is huge....it is all along the perimeter of the Marina and at one end of the Marina are public washrooms and a food stalls area while at the opposite end of the Marina is also another food stalls area. The washrooms are clean but my son said in one of the men's stalls there was no toilet paper. So best to bring some with you.

There were so many unique items showcasing the talent of all these artisans that it was amazing. Our favorite was this lady making tiny and large kaleidoscopes out of broken glass and bottles....absolutely beautiful and ingenious!

Quite a few of the vendors from Saturday's PV market were also at the La Cruz market plus many many other ones we have never seen before.

You can get fresh breads, bagels, cheese, tortilla chips, salsas, organic products like chia seeds, spirolina, baked cooks, tamales, empanadas--mushroom and cheese for 35 pesos each was our favorite. There were a few stalls selling veggies but not many.

At the front of the Marina food stall they were selling tangerine juice for 70 pesos for a venti size but if you go towards the opposite end of the Marina, a different stall was selling orange juice for only 25 pesos but grande size. The OJ was sweet and very good for only 25 pesos.

Unfortunately we had a huge breakfast at the condo before we went to the market otherwise we would have liked to eat at the Market. 

This is one market not to be missed as it is definitely a FEAST for the eyes and mouth!

After we finished the Marina area, we walked a very short distance and found a small local artisan flea market type in the town center square. From there we walked towards the highway to catch a bus to BUCERIAS to check out the town and their local market.
The bus was 11 pesos each and it was only a very short less than 10 minute bus ride.

We finish with a trip to the fish vendors and the variety is great and always fresh. Prices are very reasonable and it is always a great experience.

550427131.name: lovely art, yummy food, friendly people, BEAUTIFUL backdrop
550427131.author: a TripAdvisor user
550427131.reviewBody: On a recent trip to Punta de Mita, we were fortunately encouraged to make the short trip (20 mins??) to the Sunday morning La Cruz market. Our Sunday morning happened to be Christmas Eve day-they were open!  Lovely handmade pieces everywhere-we found our Talavera sink (yeah!) There were textiles, hand painted serving bowls/trays, jewelry, clothing & more. Take your time meandering, don\'t miss the "food court" as the path juts out onto a pier like area. There were numerous yummy options big & small to enjoy as you wandered or to take home & enjoy for several days (beautiful breads, cakes etc). Lots of unique, organic & refreshing juices. I had empanadas, my hubby enjoyed a pork sandwich &  our daughter found Indian (yes, authentic). All delicious & very reasonably priced. The people were a happy, polite mix of many backgrounds, mostly Spanish, US & Canadians. Lots of families. Arrive early, it gets crowded. Also, the fish market looked wonderful. It was clean & full of many varieties & sizes. Sadly, we were leaving early the next day, so we didn\'t partake. If you have the chance & a grill, do yourself a favor & pickup something fresh! There were beautiful & exotic flowers for sale in the fish market. Lovely, lovely morning.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

545086440.name: Hand Craft Market well worth the trip
545086440.author: a TripAdvisor user
545086440.reviewBody: We have been to PV Paradise Village and Bucerias markets and La Cruz is the best. Everything is local and hand made. Nothing from China! Artisans are there carving wood, blowing glass , making tacos etc \n

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

538883523.name: Best market!
538883523.author: a TripAdvisor user
538883523.reviewBody: La Cruz Sunday market is the best of Nayarit. You can spend the all morning there and have a great lunch!\nLove all the artisan little shops and the organic foods selections are amazing.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

482752494.name: The Mercado at La Cruz
482752494.author: a TripAdvisor user
482752494.reviewBody: Excellent arts and crafts, food and good music.  All crafts are locally made.  Great place to visit on Sundays.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

482728726.name: Beach side town.
482728726.author: a TripAdvisor user
482728726.reviewBody: This town was nothing special.  I won\'t be going back here as there wasn\'t much to do or see here. The beach was ok.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

476235791.name: Came highly recommended and did not disappoint
476235791.author: a TripAdvisor user
476235791.reviewBody: Staying in a condo not far from las Cruz and went today (is Sunday only from 10-2pm)last one this year is May 7th!   Everything set up along walk by the water and up and on the jetty.   Lots of nice offerings.   A lot of the art and booths were operated by other than local people.   The food offerings available were varied and delicious.   Hard to pass them by.   Even sweet rolls are there and locally baked.    We were really impressed by the fish markets and the available varieties.   Markets not connected to market walk and I\'m sure they are open daily.   Go early for best selection we were told but I sure didn\'t see any shortage on choices.     Bought some nice souvenirs and food and had a great time too

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

473170944.name: So Much to See
473170944.author: a TripAdvisor user
473170944.reviewBody: Went to the market this past Sunday and WOW! It is so entertaining, so much to do and see and EAT! I also loved the musical entertainment they had, while you walk around and shop. Had a snack, a meal, bought groceries for the week, and still feel I could of got more there! will be going back this Sunday for round two.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

471256528.name: Love this area of Mexico
471256528.author: a TripAdvisor user
471256528.reviewBody: Just love this area of Mexico.  I should say I hate it so no one else will find it and go!  The street,  the food,  the bars,  the entire scene is compared to none! \u2764\u2764

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

467107669.name: A must visit
467107669.author: a TripAdvisor user
467107669.reviewBody: Always look forward to the market, a mix of crafts, people and great food. Fish market is always great, stock up on baking, coffee, pasta (especially good and fresh), produce and other products. Then have lunch.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

465957298.name: Lovely market in winter time!
465957298.author: a TripAdvisor user
465957298.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this beautiful market by the ocean and the Marina! You can eat breakfast or lunch and buy all kind of stuff, from local crafts to jewelry, to organic produce, hand made soap, you name it! \nEvery Sunday from 10-2 \nBe sure to get there at least at 1 pm cause everyone starts packing before 2

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

456218876.name: Fantastic "higher end" type of market.
456218876.author: a TripAdvisor user
456218876.reviewBody: A wide collection of talented artist displays.  This includes local foods and homemade preserves etc.  You can also purchase any kind of fresh fish from local fishermen.  A tourist\'s MUST.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

452518347.name: Bring Pesos!
452518347.author: a TripAdvisor user
452518347.reviewBody: The Sunday market is like non-other.  It is an upscale assortment of foods, lotions, clothes, linens, rugs, jewellery,  handbags, hats, glass blowers, hanging art, \npottery, greeting cards, dog gear, flowers, and more.  A great place to find a unique gift for that someone special, even if it is yourself!  Everything is handmade and every vendor has a colourful history.  Meander this great market on the beautiful marina while listening to the music of the day.  Stay for breakfast at the popular Osso\'s and then wander down the beach.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

444328878.name: Good Sunday Morning Adventure
444328878.author: a TripAdvisor user
444328878.reviewBody: The market is a good experience and you can find just about anything at the vendors from fresh vegetables, homemade bread, bagels, pasta\'s, spices you name it.  Many arts and craft items both unique to standard malocon items.  The food and drink vendors had so many things to choose from you really had a choice if you were hungry. \n\nDon\'t miss this opportunity.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

437859061.name: La Cruz Farmers Market
437859061.author: a TripAdvisor user
437859061.reviewBody: This is the best Farmers Market in Nayyrit.  The biggest and diverse, something for everyone!  Sundays only in season a must go!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

437648206.name: La Cruz Sunday Market
437648206.author: a TripAdvisor user
437648206.reviewBody: Fun, higher quality market to browse.  It has live music, a food area with local vendors, arts, crafts, cigars (my favourite) and 2 restaurants.  Well worth the trip over to see.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

427877649.name: A must do wherever you are in the Bay
427877649.author: a TripAdvisor user
427877649.reviewBody: I\'m very familiar with the entire Bay and I will say that this is at the top of my list of things go do. Not only does it offer all the things that people are mentioning, but it also is a social event! There is music, dancing, food, liquor and more. It really offers something interesting for any age.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

397456216.name: Busy busy place!!
397456216.author: a TripAdvisor user
397456216.reviewBody: The Sunday market at the LA Cruz marina is a very popular spot for tourists from all over the area.  It has a great many things for sale, something for everyone! Quality handmade goods, organic veggies, honey, yogurt also breads and bagels. That is just a small selection of what\'s available.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

384720787.name: Sunday Market in La Cruz
384720787.author: a TripAdvisor user
384720787.reviewBody: I just returned from spending three lovely weeks in La Cruz. Enroute to  the market, by the guard shack going into the Marina, is a wild grove of environmentally protected iguanas. Sometimes I leave soft fruit such as mango and vegetables on the ground for them. They will come down and eat if you stand far enough away. Also, to avoid disappointment, the Sunday Market is from October to May. The fish market is open daily for fresh fish, all throughout the year.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

382519957.name: Lovely
382519957.author: a TripAdvisor user
382519957.reviewBody: Vendors were friendly and great deals. Yummy food and great souvenirs to take home. Nice view while shopping. We were there the last open weekend so it seemed smaller than expected. We were just hoping for more vendors.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

374179356.name: Another good day trip from Puerto Vallarta or Nuevo Vallarta.
374179356.author: a TripAdvisor user
374179356.reviewBody:
An upscale market experience from the daily flea market in Bucerias, there is lots of food, local artisans and a fish market as well at the Sunday morning market in La Cruz.

I will not repeat the comments of others but would specifically mention the excellent bread/buns available for purchase or as an on-site lunch. If you want a cerveza to wash it down there is an open air restaurant that serves drinks.

We feel it is well worth the trip to La Cruz from the nearby locations such as PV, NV and Bucerias.

For tourists, please be aware that this market is available only on Sundays, will be crowded (as it is popular of course) and is most easily accessed by rental car or taxi. We suggest talking with your concierge or a local trip operator to ensure you get the best experience. If you do go by taxi, there are people on site who will call you a cab for your return trip. As such it may be a good idea to share your ride coming or going.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

361330646.name: Unexpected food and cosas
361330646.author: a TripAdvisor user
361330646.reviewBody: Many gorgeous unique vendors of art, clothing and delish food on the naturale/organic  BEST naturale yogurt, sin azucar  \n

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

359876020.name: Most Unique Quesadillas Ever!
359876020.author: a TripAdvisor user
359876020.reviewBody: This amazing place was located at the far end of the breaker. Great homemade corn tortillas (for gluten-free dining) made by the mom on a one-of-a-kind tortilla press of her own design. The smoky chipotle salsa complimented the nopales and stewed chicken on my quesadilla deliciously. \nThey are one of the few eating places to offer a sitting area.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

358475596.name: A must visit
358475596.author: a TripAdvisor user
358475596.reviewBody: If you\'re in the area on a Sun. you simply must visit the market down by the marina. All sorts of crafts, entertainment, and food food and more food . Pick up some wonderful fresh bread and sweets,gotta have tomatoes and avacados. I could go on and on about all the wonderful things to see and taste. Great place to have lunch at either Ozo\'s or one of the vendors. And of course the fresh seafood is amazing. A definate must see place.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

357916368.name: Upscale market
357916368.author: a TripAdvisor user
357916368.reviewBody: Always fun, especially taking newcomers to Sunday Bucerias market then on to the more touristy La Cruz affair.  Great pork buns!!  New local fashions, fresh food & the usual tourist array.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

354201653.name: An excellent way to spend a Sunday
354201653.author: a TripAdvisor user
354201653.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed the Sunday Farmer\'s Market which offered everything from fresh seafood to beautiful hand made rugs.  We bought fresh bread, fresh vegetables and fresh seafood for our week\'s groceries.  There was a great variety of vendors.  Admission is FREE and well worth the time investment.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

350547132.name: Art,Crafts, Foods and Music!
350547132.author: a TripAdvisor user
350547132.reviewBody: This event happens every Sunday morning, starting around 9:00 and goes until 1-2 p.m.  It is set up down by the Marina and fish market.  It has artists from many towns showing their artwork, including glasswork, metal work, paintings, jewelery, clothing, etc.  There are organic food booths with a variety of items to buy, including honey, gluten free bread, yogurt, etc.  There are also many booths set up out on the far end of the pier with excellent food to buy for eating right there.  There is always music and a great atmosphere of community fun.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

349740126.name: Lots to see and taste
349740126.author: a TripAdvisor user
349740126.reviewBody: Want to spend a great Sunday morning/afternoon? This is the place.  Lots of great food to enjoy, variety galore!  Some cheesy novelties for purchase but for the most part a good place to find options you can\'t find elsewhere.  Music nice touch, in the background.  Centre of attention if the fish/seafood vendors!  Bring a Spanish speaking friend to translate to get the real deals.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

347888218.name: Good to visit once
347888218.author: a TripAdvisor user
347888218.reviewBody: Mostly made up of gringos selling their wares. More expensive then the bucerias market. Not a lot of fruits and vegetables. Lots of good food choices. They have great bagels. Very busy and hard to get through the narrow aisles. Glad we went, but don\'t see the value in returning. You can get better selection of produce at the bucerias Sunday market.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

347199066.name: Marina and Market
347199066.author: a TripAdvisor user
347199066.reviewBody: This market is awesome they have lots of organic foods, and they have lots of fresh foods being cooked on the street. I also enjoyed looking at all of the local vendors which had little arts and crafts music and clothes from the area. Everything is so cheap especially when the peso is good. The market is only on Sundays make sure you go early because it gets extremely busy but it does run all day. The market is right on the boardwalk of the marina. The marina is one of the nicest marinas in the entire Banderas Bay. The marina has free Wi-Fi clean showers to amazing restaurants, one being Frascati, and the other la pesca. I think that Frascati is an amazing Italian restaurant from the servers to the recipes and the view you get when you sit by the window. It is an open balcony so if it\'s windy bring a sweater, although my grandma didn\'t have a sweater and the waiter brought a cashmere throw blanket to put around her. That was very classy in my opinion. The marina also has a great staff that speaks a little bit of English so you can ask questions that are necessary for getting around or getting help. I recommend this marina, and anyone who wants to may take a day trip to Puerto Vallarta or Sayulita can do so, via and Autobus, taxi or if you have a rental car, it is a 30 minute drive. La Cruz also has many great restaurants to dine at which served between 15 pesos to 110 pesos with excellent service and all have Wi-Fi. The cruise de Huanacaxtle is an awesome place to Vacay!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

339704865.name: Great shopping in a stunning setting with free umbrellas to give you shade, family friendly
339704865.author: a TripAdvisor user
339704865.reviewBody: The La Cruz Market, sometimes called the Fish Market is down on the marina in La Cruz on Sundays between 10-2 pm.  There are ex pat and Mexican vendors selling everything from handblown glass work to Samosas and organically grown mangoes sold by ex pats from Seattle.\nWe were charmed by the umbrella lending stations at various points in the market to use for shade from the brilliant Mexican sun.  there is tons to choose from in ingredients, food for take out or enjoying on the beach adjoining the market or treasures to take home to your vacation rental, condo  or Canada. Love it and will certainly go back!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

337403544.name: Awesome Food Fest - MUST GO
337403544.author: a TripAdvisor user
337403544.reviewBody:
Great selection of different kinds of foods, crafts and groceries. 

Regarding food, it's perfect for trying lots of fun, delicious small things. There is a lot to try but almost everything I had was 5 stars. 

Really fun to walk around too.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

337054938.name: Fun and  a few great local crafts
337054938.author: a TripAdvisor user
337054938.reviewBody: Easy to find, right by the cruise ships at Marina Central.\nBarter and fun until it is time for a cool drink!\nGreat local crafts I did not see elsewhere also lots of stuff that you do see everywhere too!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

335241264.name: A fun family activity
335241264.author: a TripAdvisor user
335241264.reviewBody: Be sure and get the Marlin empanadas ...lots of local crafts and the fish market is fun to see as well...even the kids had fun

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

334126787.name: Fabulous
334126787.author: a TripAdvisor user
334126787.reviewBody: This is a fun must see. Take the bus and make a morning of it. Food and shopping and music. Picturesque and photogenic marina setting.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

333195700.name: Love this market
333195700.author: a TripAdvisor user
333195700.reviewBody: I have been to this market at least 8 times and I cant say a bad thing about it. The fresh food is delicious. The fish market absolutely excellent. One of our family favorites.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

332653815.name: First stop
332653815.author: a TripAdvisor user
332653815.reviewBody: We live in La Cruz and the Farmers Market provides a lot of food and craft staples at our home.  Fresh produce, flowers, seafood, cheese, pastries as well as colorful handmade rugs, pillows and accessories are just a few of the items you can count on.  Prices are reasonable, but don\'t be afraid to bargain.  \n

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

326927261.name: Great food..great people...great crafts!
326927261.author: a TripAdvisor user
326927261.reviewBody: This market is huge! Lots of great products and original ideas. Live music and fresh food being cooked on the spot. Smells..music...sunshine...boats...AMAZING!\nYou can take a bus or Collectivo for pretty cheap. It cost us about $2.10 can or 250 pesos each to get there from PV. There is a bus stop outside the first corner store and a sign in the middle of the road that says \'Marina\'...that\'s where you need to get off. It\'s a (hot) 5-10 min walk down a dusty road to get there. As you get closer it\'ll be more obvious where to go. Will definitely make the trek back up there next time I\'m in PV(my husband even enjoyed himself:)bonus!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

326091930.name: This market is better each year!
326091930.author: a TripAdvisor user
326091930.reviewBody: Many new craft persons this year. Most are from this area, near La Cruz so often we were invited to their\nwork studios. Many one of a kind artisan isn\'t. Food on either end of the market. Most is home made and delicious. What would you like? Fresh fruit, home made ice cream, baked goods, pickles, humus, tostados, empanadas, pizza....I am missing listing so much more.\nthat was offered. And of course, the fresh seafood market  located on the north side of the market.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

268193161.name: Last Market of the Season
268193161.author: a TripAdvisor user
268193161.reviewBody: We caught the market on the last day of the season.  So very lucky due to the wonderful artisans.  If you can get to the market, you won\'t be disappointed!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

267705436.name: Now this is shopping!
267705436.author: a TripAdvisor user
267705436.reviewBody: This is the second year we\'ve visited the Farmer\'s Market and made sure it was at the top of our list!  The atmosphere is exciting and the crafts and jewelry were extraordinary.  What a fun way to spend the morning. We took a cab from Nuevo Vallarta - Paradise Village and our cab driver waited for us for three hours.  His father had a fish market there and we spent some time with his father and the fish! Lots of food and music and my husband found a seat and I enjoyed strolling the market two, maybe three times.  Wish we could bring more home on the plane!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

265297200.name: So many stalls, beautiful setting.
265297200.author: a TripAdvisor user
265297200.reviewBody:
A friend of my son was told about this market so we decided to check it out. There's a bus that goes there but required transferring so we took a taxi and split the cost.

It was much bigger than expected with all kinds of goods from gourmet foods to leather belts & wallets, glass-blown art, metal art, ice cream, silver and beaded jewelry, cotton clothing and t-shirts, seafood, flowers... you name it. All the items were of good quality. \

There were several food stalls and a restaurant (oyster bar?). Other than the restaurant, there weren't many places to sit and take in the atmosphere. The entire event is right on the marina with lots of beautiful photo opportunities but it's quite hot and with the stalls being so close together, there's not much of a breeze. I was glad we brought water even though it was warm by then. Many locals were swimming in the ocean on the adjoining bay (just beyond the stalls) which had a large sandy embankment. I believe there were  public washrooms behind the buildings. There's a taxi stand at the far end where you enter the marina area. We only waited about 5 minutes for a taxi - that was after we waited 20 minutes for our original taxi driver to return at the pre-arranged time... which he didn't! That was the only downside to the day trip. The market is quite interesting and varied.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

263250219.name: A little slice of Mexican culture!
263250219.author: a TripAdvisor user
263250219.reviewBody: We got to market in their last hour so I think we missed the big crowds.  What we found were some amazing artists.  There was handcrafted bread, yogurt, cheese, jewelry, purses and fresh flowers.  There were quite a few food vendors selling some pretty awesome things to eat.  The very best part was the live music with a couple 4 yr olds dancing to "La Bamba"!  Priceless,

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

262561065.name: A fun experience!
262561065.author: a TripAdvisor user
262561065.reviewBody: A few of us took our families to the Sunday market.  It was a great experience with many different options for ethnic foods.  It was cool to see all of the tents with different local fares.  If you are looking for some good local adventures I would suggest a few hours here.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

260154537.name: GREAT MARKET!
260154537.author: a TripAdvisor user
260154537.reviewBody: My girlfriends and I were on a "girls trip" and we went to the market Feb. 22. We had so much fun!!!! We got snacks of delicious cheeses and breads and pesto for our room during the week. We purchased gifts for our families back home, things like fresh rolled cigars, organic coffee and jewelry. We looked at flowers, soaps, candles, swim covers, purses and shoes for ourselves, toys for kids. AND THE FOOD..... it was everywhere! Food to eat there or take with you..... fruits, veggies, pasta, fish, breads and pastries, sauces, jellies, honey, sandwiches, waffles, ....already pre-made food or things to prepare wonderful dishes where you were staying. Vendors were kind and helpful. The whole crowd of shoppers were wonderful! There was entertainment everywhere!! We then stopped and had bloody Mary\'s at one of the open restaurants. It was a perfect day at the market with beautiful views of the water!! We would go back every Sunday, if we could....

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

254313389.name: no one wants to go there any more...it\'s way too crowded!
254313389.author: a TripAdvisor user
254313389.reviewBody: lots of great vendors here and we always enjoy our visits,although we think they need to consider another venue with more space.  The town square would be a nice choice but then it is removed from the fish market and restaurants.  \nThere are 10 or 12 vendors who hang out in the main square which is a block and a half west of the current market location (past Ana Banana\'s)  and one can shop more comfortably and with lots of shade.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

251294645.name: Wow great experience.
251294645.author: a TripAdvisor user
251294645.reviewBody: The largest fresh fish market I have ever seen. Took the local bus hard to figure out which one to get back.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

251178150.name: Great market and full support to local economy
251178150.author: a TripAdvisor user
251178150.reviewBody: Finally had the chance to visit the market and more than the beautiful location, the market looks very well organized and full of different things to find. I think is a special market full of artisans selling their handcrafts and creations, it\'s great to meet them. You can find any kind of gift, lots of furniture, jewlery and many options for vegetarian, vengan and organic food. One the good things about this market is the full support to the local economy with the purchasing. After visiting the market make sure to get some fresh seafood on the fish market just next door.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

250397543.name: Quite interesting place for foodies
250397543.author: a TripAdvisor user
250397543.reviewBody:
The Sunday Farmers' Market, located by the fresh seafood market, draws real crowds! There are lots of handcrafted items, organic produce, arts, crafts, and food stands. I think foodies would be delighted here. I had there the best choripan ever!
(choripan = type of sandwich with pork sausage hot off the grill, split down the middle, and served on a crusty bread roll with chimichurri)
The market was kind of close to what I imagined, though a tiny bit less rustic. 
Way too busy for my daughter's liking, but that's how places like this are.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

250023522.name: A great Sunday morning shopping
250023522.author: a TripAdvisor user
250023522.reviewBody: We went to the market at the Marina and got there at 9:30. It was filled with vendors selling everything from local crafts to produce and delicious prepared food!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

246581903.name: Sunday farmers market in La Cruz
246581903.author: a TripAdvisor user
246581903.reviewBody: Have visited many times and each time find something new. Friendly atmosphere. Vendors are from all over the world. Awesome fresh shrimp

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

243204891.name: Busy!
243204891.author: a TripAdvisor user
243204891.reviewBody: Don\'t go here during high season if you hate crowds!  We go, not for the typical flea market gifts, but to buy fresh bread and pasta, make our weekly fish purchase, and to check out the new offerings.  Look for Christina (we call her the card lady) for beautiful handcrafted cards and the other vendors offering artisan handmade soaps, the best Italian sausage on the bay!  Have the sausage in a sandwich for lunch or take home a package for great homemade pizzas and pasta sauce.  Parking is a nightmare!  So park up the street and take a stroll.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

235437916.name: only in Winter but worth early morning
235437916.author: a TripAdvisor user
235437916.reviewBody: As locals we enjoy the stroll next to the Marina and grab a delicious bite from any of the artisan food stands. Don\'t go after 11 am because it gets too crowded and parking is a pain. Yes there are many Expats, but ridiculously they often appreciate better the Mexican culture... A little bit of everything and a wonderful walk: definitely worth it!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

207662248.name: The most relaxing shopping experience ever!
207662248.author: a TripAdvisor user
207662248.reviewBody: Eat, drink and be merry at the La Cruz Sunday Market. Get a bathing suit made, buy gifts for loved ones, pick up your weekly supply of fresh food or hang around and enjoy the music, mingle with friends and meet new folks.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

205582611.name: Quality food and a great variety of Arts/Crafts... but expensive and crowded
205582611.author: a TripAdvisor user
205582611.reviewBody:
This market is really cool the first couple of times you go, but has grown in popularity and has some growing pains to overcome. Parking is a huge issue, and if you don't get there early, you will have a long way to walk. Prices in this market are very high... catering to Canadian and American Tourists with money to spend on unique items.
It really is a nice place, with nice people and unique items for sale... its a lot different than the regular Flea Markets in the area. Many of the items you see here, can not be bought anywhere else. However, because the focus here is on Tourists with money in pocket, you can expect to pay more. 
The food here is very good... multi-cultural... everything from Mexican to Arabian cuisine. The Arts and Crafts are good quality and nicely displayed... The fish market is fun to watch, as the fresh fish comes off the boats, and guys filet the Dorado, Tuna or Red Snappers....
Overall its a fun experience... but is crowded and expensive. Great place to meet other tourists, but not for a relaxing morning...

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

202975849.name: Overpriced ex-pat hippie vibe
202975849.author: a TripAdvisor user
202975849.reviewBody: If you\'re staying in a condo and you have a rental car - you might enjoy getting some local "artisanal" bread or dips.  If you\'re in a hotel and taking a cab - don\'t bother.  It didn\'t feel like authentic Mexico - much more like Portlandia\'s Saturday market - downwardly-mobile white kids and their dogs slumming in Mexico selling overpriced jewelry.  I recommend Bucerias instead.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

200987815.name: Great eats, food, fish and crafts
200987815.author: a TripAdvisor user
200987815.reviewBody: We have been to all markets from La Penita to Puerto Vallarta and inbetween.  They are all unique, but we really enjoy the La Cruz market.  There is a great variety of food served up, sandwiches, juices, vegetarian, the most delicious donuts.  The setting is pretty along the marina and in the center there is always some great live music, you can sit and listen.  The crafts and gourmet food condiments are mostly made by Canadians/Americans who live there.  There are items made more for the tourist palate, smoked fish, dips, salad dressings as well as great fresh produce like strawberries, fresh herbs and squash blossoms.  Bought some delicious food to cook with.  If you are looking for a mexican market, this is not it, but we love going there every year for some delicious treats and the beautiful atmosphere.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

194394444.name: Crowded tourist trap
194394444.author: a TripAdvisor user
194394444.reviewBody: I have been to the Saturday farmers market in downtown Puerto Vallarta and it is much better.  There is more room to move around. There were so many people in La Cruz it was hard to get to the tables. The prices were a also quite high - probably because there isn\'t as much competition there. We did get some really good bread and the shrimp from the fish sellers was great on the grill.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

192566458.name: Fun times!
192566458.author: a TripAdvisor user
192566458.reviewBody: We had a great time with our two kids. Be sure you make it all the way to the end where all the food is at! We had the Paella, ice cream (only 20 pesos!) and fresh juices. There were so many delicious things to eat! Also, at the rear of the music area is a free kids craft table. I wish we would have found this earlier because the kids could have participated. They use paint to do this early and let the paint dry before you leave.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

190050503.name: MustGo Attraction
190050503.author: a TripAdvisor user
190050503.reviewBody: We stay every year in Sayulita, Nuevo Vallarta and surroundings. The La Cruz Sunday market is one of the best authentic experiences around. Good music, food, local crafts, and a terrific fish market with the day\'s catch. Don\'t miss this.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

188361948.name: Go go go!
188361948.author: a TripAdvisor user
188361948.reviewBody: The market is wonderful.  Fresh veggies, lots of artisan cheeses, jams, and other food items.  Quality hand made items (not the usual stuff you find in the street shops) - clothing, jewelry, household items.  We go every week when we are in La Cruz!!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

186266124.name: One of the best
186266124.author: a TripAdvisor user
186266124.reviewBody: We generally stay in Sayulita when we visit Mexico but we ensure we make it to the market in La Cruz. Great food, live music, wonderful artisans..probably the most diversified market of its kind I have been to. And everybody mills around having a good time. We never go home emptyhanded.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

185809153.name: We always love to go there!
185809153.author: a TripAdvisor user
185809153.reviewBody: The Sunday Farmer\'s Market in La Cruz is a very attractive market. I love it that all of the vendors sell their own product and there is a big variety on food, arts and crafts and music! We love it.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

185793248.name: In PV or Nuevo? La Cruz\'s Farmers Market well worth the trip
185793248.author: a TripAdvisor user
185793248.reviewBody:
The two years my wife and I lived in La Cruz we rarely miss a Sunday at the market. We would begin by buying our fish for the week.  When the sellers saw me coming they would shout, "here comes Cap'n Paul slice off piece of Atun" which I would eat raw right there on the spot to the amazement of the tourist.

Then we would stroll along the waterfront buying fresh veggies and other tasty delights from the many vendors. Our market day ended at Oso's for a great breakfast and to people watch.

True wanderers  take the bus from PV or Nuevo.  Our Canadian friends always do.
Bon Appetite. 

Cap'n Paul

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

178034369.name: Unique finds!
178034369.author: a TripAdvisor user
178034369.reviewBody: Loved that it wasn\'t cookie-cutter souveniers. Very nice artisan work and a great variety of vendors!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

169767471.name: The best food, including organic fresh and prepared goods
169767471.author: a TripAdvisor user
169767471.reviewBody: Not to be missed!  Great food, arts and crafts, and music.  La Cruz is a gem- still "real Mexico" with wonderful people, lots of music and restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

169669992.name: Farmer\'s Market in La Cruz de Huanacaxtle
169669992.author: a TripAdvisor user
169669992.reviewBody: The Farmer\'s Market in La Cruz is one of the best and most diversified markets available anywhere!  Everything is available, from jewelry, art, glass blowing, carvings, items for your home, to some of the very best food items, all topped of with live music!  Located in the beautiful La Cruz Marina and next to the fresh fish market!  Come and visit, you will not be disappointed!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

157419229.name: FARMERS MARKET IN LA CRUZ MEXICO,
157419229.author: a TripAdvisor user
157419229.reviewBody: What a great market for people that want to kill a half day on a sunday about 200 vendors,a great meeting place with two restuarants and lots of music and a great setting,\n\nDO NOT HAVE BREAKFAST BEFORE YOU GO AS THERES SO MANY EATING STALL WITH GREAT FOOD,

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

155139919.name: Fascinating Market, Beautiful Location
155139919.author: a TripAdvisor user
155139919.reviewBody:
If you're in the Puerto Vallarta area, grab the local bus early on Sunday morning.  Whoever designed the layout and landscape for this market knew about optimizing the experience.  Apparently all goods sold are Mexican, and most of the vendors live in the area.  From baked goods and brunch dishes to fresh fish and produce, handcrafted gifts and clothing, to live music and yoga in the round... a wonderful experience!  

The Market is located about 10 minutes walk from the Highway bus stop.  Keep walking toward the harbour and keep an eye out for the barbed wire hanging very close to the sidewalk.

Highly recommended!  Bring your camera.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

153095213.name: great way to spend Sunday morning!
153095213.author: a TripAdvisor user
153095213.reviewBody: Plan this must-do outting as a 1/2 day of music, food, entertainment, crafts from around the bay, fish market, and interesting people in a lovely setting.  Talk to the locals and you\'ll come away with interesting things-  we tried the parrot fish ("blue fish") and it was almost like lobster and really enjoyed the gentleman playing a hang.  Buy your shrimp and fish right off the boat but look for vendors who advertise they will clean and devien the srimp for you (a real bargin at 20 pesos per kilo).  Bring a small cooler and they will even fill it with ice.  One Sunday we snacked with the vendors at the farmer\'s market (found gluten free)- next Sunday we headed over to the larger Marina itself after shopping for their Sunday brunch with live entertainment. Wear good walking shoes as parking can be a little tricky. You will need 5 peso to use the washrooms at the market.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

150776399.name: Quality products - No kitsch!
150776399.author: a TripAdvisor user
150776399.reviewBody: Whether you want top knotch arts and crafts from jewellery to clothes or really great home baked goods, you want to take in this market. Go in the morning when it is a bit cooler. Treat yourself to a home made treat and take time to look over the carvings, basketry and unique jewelery. I bought a great carving board with a grooved out section for serving - whatever - made from local wood. Sunday\'s only from 10 - 2. Don\'t miss this!

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

144895928.name: Must do this on a Sunday morning!
144895928.author: a TripAdvisor user
144895928.reviewBody: This market is a refreshing change from the typical t-shirts and trinkets you see everywhere else.  These are handmade crafts, jewelry, food, etc. and is a great experience.  More vendors than the Puerto Vallarta market, plus it is right beside the fish market in a beautiful marina.  The entrance is a bit hard to find the first time, but the best advice is - when driving through La Cruz turn on the road with the sign for the Oso Oyster Bar restaurant.  This restaurant and Eva\'s Brickhouse are both located in the same area as the market.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

125401688.name: surprising variety of wares in an idyllic setting
125401688.author: a TripAdvisor user
125401688.reviewBody: The Sunday market at La Cruz has moved to a new location, in fact, 2 locations.  There is an ordinary market a block from the zocalo, which is undergoing repairs, but the more arty market is on a winding strip along by the Marina, the fish market and Eva\'s Brickhouse.
