Shaded by palms, this new location is picturesque and user friendly.  Live music adds to the festive atmosphere.  There is an abundance of jewelry for sale by artisans, as well as distinctive clothing  and trinkets. As you reach the jetty, you find produce and various prepared foods.  Even if you are not a shopper (I\'m not), it\'s a colorful scene to observe.

address.streetAddress: Riviera Nayarit Navy Cruz Huanacaxtle Nay.

670016384.name: Have I died and gone to heaven?
670016384.author: a TripAdvisor user
670016384.reviewBody: It\u2019s a bit out of the way but this is a gorgeous beach. I\u2019m not a bus person but am a control freak so taxis are not my thing so I had to buy a car so I could get to Destiladeras from La Cruz to spend an hour each day jogging this beach from one end to the other. Only 375,000 pesos for the car. I\u2019d buy two if I had to.

667519524.name: Amazing beach
667519524.author: a TripAdvisor user
667519524.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful beach, can walk for longer than you can see!  We took the bus from La Cruz, Easy and fast. When we arrived, it was packed with locals (Holy week), who celebrated all day long. We had a hard time finding someone to rent us an umbrella but once we got that straight, all was great. Spent the afternoon body surfing and people watching. Fun way to spend an afternoon!

666090613.name: World class beach!
666090613.author: a TripAdvisor user
666090613.reviewBody: In March 2019 we enjoyed a great beach day under our umbrella enjoying the great service of the restaurant.\nThe beach is incredible, fine sand rolling waves and you can walk the beach for miles in either direction. The grand kids enjoyed playing in the saves and boogie boarding. We arrived around 12am. and rented  a beach side table.\nWe enjoyed great beverage service and some great snacks ( guacamole, chips and salsa, and quesadillas) all afternoon. Sadly we had other plans for dinner and so we didn\'t get to try the pescado sarandiado, which the waiter told us was their signature dish. So, shucks, darn, we are going to have to go back and try it....soon!

665152483.name: Great boogie boarding!
665152483.author: a TripAdvisor user
665152483.reviewBody: Beautiful beach that we enjoyed a few times is just a short bus ride from La Cruz. Tables, umbrellas and chairs are rented. Good service. Great view. We enjoyed boogie boarding in the waves. Showers helpful to wash off sand. Nice firm sand and flat beach - good to walk on.

661923905.name: Beautiful beach, chairs and umbrellas for rent
661923905.author: a TripAdvisor user
661923905.reviewBody: A lovely clean, windswept beach with free parking.  Halfway between La Cruz and Punta Mita on the beach road.  Go in the morning to rent a table, umbrella and four chairs.  Table service for snacks and beer - a gorgeous view.  The water is warm, there is a strong surf that can toss you around.  A good hour walk from the cafe area to the western end - the eastern end is quieter.  No shade except for the umbrellas.  One used to be able to sit under the trees and on the grass for shade, but it is fenced off now.  A nice little cafe, changing rooms, bathrooms and beach showers.  Well worth the money and a short 10 minute drive from La Cruz.

660839140.name: Our favourite beach in Nayarit!
660839140.author: a TripAdvisor user
660839140.reviewBody: Gorgeous beach.  Love to walk along it\u2019s flat beach!  Beautiful view!   Great to spend the day there!   You really do not want to get up to leave to go back to your condo.

660560466.name: Gorgeous!
660560466.author: a TripAdvisor user
660560466.reviewBody: Magnificent beach, with excellent amenities (shower, toilets). The umbrellas and chairs for rent seemed a bit pricey at MXP250, but other than that, exceeded expectation. The waves were a bit too strong for our grandchildren, but they nonetheless had a great time at the edge of the surf. Certainly this is the nicest beach in the La Cruz area and well worth the trip.

660008038.name: Fabulous beach just north of La Cruz
660008038.author: a TripAdvisor user
660008038.reviewBody: This is a wonderful beach with soft sand and clear water. You can rent a table, 4 chairs and umbrella for 250 pesos for the day. You can bring your own beer and picnic lunch or they have an excellent restaurant and bar with good food and reasonable prices. There are also a couple of fruit vendors who make incredible fruit trays for your table for only 50 pesos.\nThis is a fabulous place to spend the day.

655723356.name: A super family day at the beach
655723356.author: a TripAdvisor user
655723356.reviewBody: Arrived around 10:00 AM & found a table & chairs for a nominal fee. Needed extra chairs and they were delivered immediately. Our waiter was Milan. Outstanding service & great advice on other attractions for our trip to Puerto Vallarta. Drinks were served ice cold and the food we ordered was delicious. Beach is beautiful! If you ever go ask for Milan\u2019s area - you won\u2019t be disappointed.

655719189.name: A lovely flat wide beach with whale activity off the beach
655719189.author: a TripAdvisor user
655719189.reviewBody: A short bus ride outside of Bucerias towards Punta Mita is this still relatively quiet and undeveloped beach. A nice restaurant with beach chairs and umbrellas for rent. A long flat wide beach long enough to have a nice walk of an hour or two. We saw (through binoculars) plenty of whale activity not too far out, including a few full breaches. A nice relaxing bit different day trip coming from Bucerias or PV

654568650.name: Amazing beach
654568650.author: a TripAdvisor user
654568650.reviewBody: Definitely worth the taxi drive out to this beach.  It wasn\u2019t crowded, the waves were a ton of fun (even if they caused a broken toe and a lost pair of good sunglasses).  The service we received for food and drinks was spectacular.  And you can\u2019t leave the beach without trying the shrimp ceviche.  I\u2019m still craving it a week later!

653017130.name: Big Waves and not busy
653017130.author: a TripAdvisor user
653017130.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with big waves. There are a couple of restaurants with beach chairs and umbrellas. My kids played in the waves for hours bring boogie board sun screen . It is 150 pecos taxi ride from La Cruxes

652632914.name: Will not disappoint
652632914.author: a TripAdvisor user
652632914.reviewBody: Beautiful beach - soft sand, clear waters. Took bus from La Cruz- 16 pesos . Paid 250 pesos for umbrella and lounge chairs. Vendor selling fresh fruit - 50 pesos - very good. Other vendors non intrusive and polite. Watched whales cavorting not far off shore. Bus back was 12 pesos. Would definitely recommend !!!

651473226.name: An unbelievable beach
651473226.author: a TripAdvisor user
651473226.reviewBody: The beach is spectacular.  The beach food service is good and the food is fine.  Remember...you\'re on a beach.\n

651037769.name: Don\u2019t tell anyone
651037769.author: a TripAdvisor user
651037769.reviewBody: This is my absolute favorite beach in this area. For 6 peso you board the ATM bus that is headed to Punta De Mita, be sure to let the driver know where you are going, the bus runs every 15 - 30 minutes and is a 10 minute ride to and from La Cruz,on the return just flag down the driver This is a public beach that seems to go forever at low tide. Great place to play with the waves, you can rent an umbrella and chair for 100 peso for  the day. Stay until sunset, it is worth it

650764918.name: Best Beach
650764918.author: a TripAdvisor user
650764918.reviewBody:
Have been going to Destilederas beach for years. Walking is superb, long flat smooth. Golden colour and firm. There can be large swells and if you don’t swim well it might be safe to just splash around on the shore line. There is a beach restaurant. Food and service excellent. 
Parking ample .. charge on the weekend. Not sure as we take the bus from Bucerías.
There is a cost for beach tables which include 4 chairs. 250 pesos.. 
all in all a great way to spend time at a beach.

648169358.name: A Beach Worthy of a Visit
648169358.author: a TripAdvisor user
648169358.reviewBody: As stated in other reviews, this is a very nice beach, great sand for walking, clear water, decent facilities (food, bar, restrooms, etc., not high end but suitable for a day at the beach.  We came by cab from Bucerias but a regular local bus does stop on the highway.  If you come by car they do have parking with a small fee, and you can rent a table/umbrella/chairs for $250 pesos (gringo price).  There is waiter service for bar and food however it can get busy so service can be slow.  We noticed that some patrons brought their own refreshments/snacks.  The beach is close to the entrance of the bay, so,as we witnessed first hand,  there is plenty of whale action from mid morning to late afternoon.\nWe will definitely return and I do recommend to visit, just to see how the other beaches on the bay look.

648152744.name: beach day
648152744.author: a TripAdvisor user
648152744.reviewBody: desdelederas is a large beach  . plenty of room to walk along the shore boogy board waves were good. rent a palapa for 250 and  order food and drinks or bring your own shade and food. great place to relax. pay bathroom is the only draw back

646206948.name: Lovely Beach with Soft Sand
646206948.author: a TripAdvisor user
646206948.reviewBody: Playa Destiladeras is one of the nicest sandy beaches I\u2019ve ever visited. The sand is wonderfully soft and the water is very swimmable. We were torn between going to the restaurant at the beach and renting a table or buying a day pass from Rancho Banderas Resort. I called Rancho Banderas and they were able to accommodate us that day, so we decided to choose that option. Our $50/pp included breakfast, lunch, drinks, access to pools, beach activities, beach loungers and umbrellas. There was also waiter service to the beach loungers. Actually, a very good deal considering the delicious food and amenities we enjoyed. If it\u2019s in your budget, I highly recommend getting the pass from Rancho Banderas. Their website does say to reserve 24 hrs in advance. \n\nWe went on a couple long walks, north toward the W Punta de Mita, and south past the beach restaurant. It was a bit crowded at the beach restaurant and the tables were close together, so I was happy we chose R. Banderas. There were many stretches of pristine and unoccupied beach, so bringing your own cooler, umbrella, and beach towels and setting up in a picturesque spot looked like a great idea too. We loved our day at Playa Destiladeras and I highly recommend a visit to this beautiful place.

643884041.name: Beautiful relaxing beach
643884041.author: a TripAdvisor user
643884041.reviewBody: We always check the tide times before we go and try to get there a couple hours before low tide, so that we can walk the entire stretch. The sand is firm and very clean. Don\u2019t hesitate to buy the fresh cut fruit and vegetable platter that is made on the spot by beach side vendors. Delicious!

642875809.name: Nice place to go for fun in the surf
642875809.author: a TripAdvisor user
642875809.reviewBody: We went here a couple times during a recent visit to the area.  Safe fun beach with parking available although they ask for a propina to watch your car. We usually went early (10am) and no one was on the beach.  There are umbrellas and chairs for rent and drinks/food service.  I would recommend arriving early if you want a seat.  It started to fill up around 11am (we visited during a slow time)

642820435.name: Stunning (but not quiet)
642820435.author: a TripAdvisor user
642820435.reviewBody: This was by far the most raw, naturally beautiful beach we visited in the Nayarit riviera region. Crashing waves (the were big the day we were there - watch your children). Blue, clean water. Soft, powdery sand. I recommend walking, as the people watching is great and the beach gets quieter and less populated as you walk away from the centre.

635590838.name: Changed
635590838.author: a TripAdvisor user
635590838.reviewBody: We were there 4 years ago and there was hardly anything there but a beautiful beach and some cart vendors. Now there is groomed paths from the bus drop off to the beach. Showers and washroom to change which is great. Lots of umbrellas chairs and loungers to rent for the day, reasturant with bar and big palapa if you needed out of sun. Beach wasn\u2019t as smooth for boogie boarding, recent storm took some of the sand away. Lots of beautiful beach to walk and see further developments happening, not so desolate anymore. Still a great day and the bus ride to and from Bucerias always an adventure.

617161168.name: The best secret in Puerto Vallarta
617161168.author: a TripAdvisor user
617161168.reviewBody: Desladeas Beach is why we stay in La Cruz de Huanacaxtle!   It\u2019s ten minutes away. We spend days, sunsets, etc there. It\u2019s clean blue water and mostly locals go there.  You can take a bus and go either direction.  Just watch the time as the public parking lot closes around sunset.  There are vendors and food available. Or bring your own stuff.  Best beach in the area. \nResorts are coming though so I just hope there is always a public entrance that remains.  (which is suppose to be there.). If you have time and want to enjoy beach day at a clean beach this is the beach.

610497975.name: Clean beach with good services
610497975.author: a TripAdvisor user
610497975.reviewBody: One of the few public beaches in Nayarit\u2019s Riviera that has clean water, good waves for boogie tables and lots of children fun. \n\nNot expensive at all, you can rent an umbrella for MX $250.00 all day and if you buy there your food and beverages you get that money back.

607710598.name: Best Beach on Banderas Bay
607710598.author: a TripAdvisor user
607710598.reviewBody: About 1.5 miles of beautiful almost deserted beach.   Nice sand and easy swimming.\n\nDrop dead Beautiful.

602503342.name: Beautiful beach!
602503342.author: a TripAdvisor user
602503342.reviewBody: Soft sand. Limited vendors. Warm water. Not much in way of concessions or shade however. A few hotels and condo complexes along stretch. W hotel on one end and Nahui restaurant on opposite end. Hot and humid in summer. Mellow waves. Dry and warm in winter. Bigger waves. Beach break.

591198712.name: Beautiful Beach
591198712.author: a TripAdvisor user
591198712.reviewBody: Great open white sand beach with a great new restaurant, palapa, and tables with umbrellas on the beach. Free parking available. Beautiful Banderas Bay view!

590431835.name: If you are staying in the north part of the bay...
590431835.author: a TripAdvisor user
590431835.reviewBody: If you will be staying in the north parte of de Bay...starting Bucerias and up, you should visit this beach. It is a long sandy beach, with both good waves to surf (at times) but calm enough to take a swim. Take a beach umbrealla withyou since there are no trees or any king of shadow. Or if you want to discover why it is said that bahi de Banderas has the most beutiful sunsets in the world, go there, grab a beer and wait for it.

588491254.name: Best beach on Banderas Bay!
588491254.author: a TripAdvisor user
588491254.reviewBody: we spent a great day at the beach restaurant enjoying the beach which is long and flat  with great waves for the kids to go boogey boarding!!

583155732.name: Nice Sandy beach
583155732.author: a TripAdvisor user
583155732.reviewBody: Lots of sand! A couple miles of walking if the tide is out and maybe a mile if it\u2019s in. The water is swimable and usually not crowded, especially early in the day. You can rent a table and 4 chairs with an umbrella all day for $250mxn and a lounger is just $50mxn. Food and drink service available. Accessible by bus.

574762710.name: Moe and Ana relaxing vacation
574762710.author: a TripAdvisor user
574762710.reviewBody: Nice and clean beach for relaxing . It is a little far from resort (about 15 minutes)and limited shuttle schedule (10AM-6PM)but there is a good mini bar and food free of charge !

571946886.name: Cool Beach, Nice Scenery, Cold Beers
571946886.author: a TripAdvisor user
571946886.reviewBody: Cools beach great for swimming with the kids. \nGot a table and service for a couple of hundred pesos for the day and a couple bucket of beer. Snacks kept appearing and vendors sold their goods. \nWas crazy busy with spring/Easter break going on. I suggest taking a walk south and check out the neat rocks, cacti, and truly desolate beaches away from the main crowd. Well worth it.

571562888.name: Nice \'niche\' beach
571562888.author: a TripAdvisor user
571562888.reviewBody: Rental house in Ixtapa, jal (near PV airport) only had one close beach so we drove all the way up here for the day.  Nice drive and the beach was very nice.  Rented a table and umbrella for the day.  It was a week day so not to many people but that was a good thing.  The physical beach size is pretty small and we would more than likely avoid it during any holiday activity. (unless you LIKE large crowds)

571363572.name: nice beach!
571363572.author: a TripAdvisor user
571363572.reviewBody:
An all day activity since it is between Punta de Mita and La Cruz de Huanacaxtle. 
You should get here early, before noon in order to get a good parking space and also a nice location in the beach. The sand is between brown sugar and icing for cake. The water was cold though, but with the warm weather it was ok. Don't forget to bring your cooler and beach umbrella so you can relax all day. 
They do have a restaurant in the area and they rent tables and chairs, they also have people selling fresh fruits and grilled shrimps. 
Don't forget to tip the people taking care of your car in the parking lot, they are very attentive and humble.

571073060.name: Very Busy for EasterWk
571073060.author: a TripAdvisor user
571073060.reviewBody: If you get to this beach before 2 p.m., during Holy Wk, it isn\'t too busy, but after 2 p.m., it is very crowded. Wind picks up after 11 a.m. and can take your beach umbrella sailing away if you don\'t anchor it. People were being brought in by the big bus loads with their tables, chairs, umbrellas, food, kids, boom boxes, etc. The parking lot was full by 2 and people were waiting for someone to leave. There was some Mexican guy selling toilet paper outside the washroom, so bring your own. Lots of vendors on the beach, but not too pushy.  It\'s a beautiful beach with soft sand and a warm breeze to keep you cool. Loved it.

570754655.name: The sand is like icing sugar!!
570754655.author: a TripAdvisor user
570754655.reviewBody: this beach is a must visit for all the people who say the area has no great beaches. This beach reminded me of cuba, clean white sand, you can walk out for quite a ways before it gets deep enough to swim. There are umbrellas and chairs to rent and food vendors as well. A bonus is the bus stops right at the parking lot!

570267350.name: Amazing beach
570267350.author: a TripAdvisor user
570267350.reviewBody: Lovely white sand beach with awesome views,.. you must bring your own chair and umbrella if you chose to hang out there for the day. There is one bar where they will serve you food and drinks and you get to enjoy their tables snd umbrellas as you are served but otherwise they charge you 200 pesos for rent!!!

570006666.name: Totally worth it
570006666.author: a TripAdvisor user
570006666.reviewBody: I just found the place on Facebook and I decided to go, we went in Holy Week and was absolute beautiful I would say a mini Cancun, the water and the lonely beach it just perfect to spend a relax day\ud83d\ude4f\ud83c\udffc

569399985.name: Lovely quiet beach
569399985.author: a TripAdvisor user
569399985.reviewBody: This beach was quiet, lovely, wonderful place to watch the sunset. It\u2019s a small beach but quaint. We were only there for sunset so not sure what it\u2019s like during the day.

565528478.name: Visit to the beach ... again
565528478.author: a TripAdvisor user
565528478.reviewBody: Well worth the visit.  We try to get there a couple of times during our stay.  It is beautiful.  Great for walking and always take a dip.  We travel there by bus from Buceries.  Palapa rented for the day for 200 pesos.  Wait staff are always ready with a menu (food/drinks).  A very relaxing day.  Would recommend as a day trip to couples, families and anyone wanting to enjoy the sand, sun and surf.

564983110.name: Peaceful and secluded
564983110.author: a TripAdvisor user
564983110.reviewBody: Wide open, breathtaking soft sand beach. Get away from crowed beach bars and sellers with family or friends. This beach offers tables,umbrellas and chairs for $200 pesos for the day. A nice variety of Mexican or American food and drinks. If u wish rent a lounge and get a great tan for a reasonable price. Try the delicious freash fruit made daily right there on the beach!\nClean restrooms and showers available. Walk for miles or take a dip in the surf. Ur vehicle will be safe in a secured parking lot for a tip to the attendant which is good karma. Or take a taxi or bus. Half way between Bucerias and Punta De Mita.

564717222.name: UNBELIEVABLE and GORGEOUS BEACH
564717222.author: a TripAdvisor user
564717222.reviewBody: We love staying in Los Veneros for this beach.  We had whale sightings every day.  One day, while my husband and son were surfing a pod of dolphins went by!  The beach is great for walking, exploring, surfing, and boogie boarding.  It is so beautiful... and quiet!!!  The most gorgeous sunsets, the Mariettas Islands are so close!

563954403.name: Wonderful Beach Day
563954403.author: a TripAdvisor user
563954403.reviewBody:
My girlfriends and I visited Destiliaderas  Beach last fall.  The beach is very flat to walk on and the water is shallow for a bit so you can walk in it.  There is also great swimming.

You can rent a table with an umbrella and chairs for the day for 200 pesos.  There is a restaurant there to serve you or you can take your own food and drinks.

The scenery is beautiful!!

562813253.name: Great Beach
562813253.author: a TripAdvisor user
562813253.reviewBody:
This is one of our favorite beaches just up from Bucerias.
Worth the 20 minute trip.
Great restaurant also on the beach. Beach chairs and tables to rent from the restaurant.
The food at the restaurant is wonderful, but a little slow. But who us in a rush when you are on vacation.
If you have not gone to this beach , you must.
Easy to get to by the local bus.

See you there.

Dr. Rico
Canada

562576886.name: A piece of Mexican Paradise
562576886.author: a TripAdvisor user
562576886.reviewBody: We\'ve been to PV and area a number of years before however this was our first time to Destiladeras Beach!  Beautiful. Clean. Family friendly. Washrooms - a real plus!  Nice restaurant. Miles of white sand. Clean water. Whale watching. STUNNING!  Comfortable amount of people. Flat walking along the surf edge.  Loved this beach - definitely one of the nicest beaches in the area.  We will go again a number of times. Almost don\'t want to review just to keep this beach a personal best secret, but then again it needs to be shared and enjoyed by many.  Everyone must work together to keep it clean!

561604359.name: Nicest beach in the area!
561604359.author: a TripAdvisor user
561604359.reviewBody:
We’ve been to Destiladeras Beach twice over the past month, once with my wife and the second time with a large group of friends. It’s a beautiful beach and nothing else we’ve seen in the region compares to it. It’s not Caribbean white powder sand, but it’s the closest you will find to it around here. Also it’s not a super crowded beach which is a welcome change. 
As has been mentioned in the past, 200 Pesos gets you a table & chairs with an umbrella for the day; good deal. You can bring your own food & beverages or order beachside service from the onsite restaurant.
The food from the restaurant was nothing to rave about, but was just fine on both of our visits. The service was also fast & friendly. We had different servers on each occasion and both were real characters!
Destiladeras Beach is a fabulous place to spend the day and recommend you check it out!

561601641.name: Best Beach on Banderas Bay!
561601641.author: a TripAdvisor user
561601641.reviewBody:
White sand, challenging an energetic surf ,has a pastoral impact  on your 3 mile
opportunity of a walk. Easy to navigate for all ages . Very family friendly.
Keep your eyes peeled for the notorious whales and dolphins.
We love the wave-soaring pelicans, as they drift over the waves for lunch.
This is a "Must Enjoy" attraction while in this community.
Highly recommended.

561095441.name: Beautiful but just ok
561095441.author: a TripAdvisor user
561095441.reviewBody: The beach itself is ok. If you drive there is a parking lot but you have to \u201ctip\u201d to park. The beach is fine white sand and fairly clean and there are vendors walking around selling food, although we didn\u2019t have any. Water is nice because it\u2019s a small shore break and you can easily walkout and swim or play without crazy big waves but it\u2019s so windy that after an hour we had to leave. Also there\u2019s is a small restaurant right there on the beach which you think would be nice but I would say stay away. Margaritas were watered down, food was cold and tasted crappy and, believe it or not, service was even worse. Very disappointed with the restaurant and slightly dissatisfied with the beach.

560742757.name: Fabulous !
560742757.author: a TripAdvisor user
560742757.reviewBody: Took the bus up from Bucerias for 15p each, walked down to the beach , grabbed a table & chairs for 200p , what a great day . Nicest beach around , fine white sand , wonderful water and a whale show to top it off

560343349.name: great beach
560343349.author: a TripAdvisor user
560343349.reviewBody: Just over to walk on this beautiful beach...had a restaurant and place to rent umbrellas. Saw Whales and Dolphins from the shore...

560038958.name: Nice Beach
560038958.author: a TripAdvisor user
560038958.reviewBody: Was one of the best beaches we visited, Very clean and the scenery was worth many pictures.Did not have time to eat to rate anything .

558923409.name: The most beautiful beach at the regian
558923409.author: a TripAdvisor user
558923409.reviewBody: Nice and very clean  beach. The sand is almost white, the water clean and very pleasant almost like a pool.\nI had a very good time over there. \nIf you are at PV or around, you must go visit this beach. Take the local bus and you will be at the door.

558912220.name: Go!
558912220.author: a TripAdvisor user
558912220.reviewBody: We were staying on the Bay of Banderas around Bucer\u00edas, but if you want to kick it up a notch for a day at the beach - make the effort and plan a day at Destiladeras. \nBest beach by far between PV and Sayulita.

558603930.name: Hawaii in Mexico!
558603930.author: a TripAdvisor user
558603930.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach with clear water.  I love swimming here.  Great place to boogie board and swim--depends on the waves.  Bring an umbrella or pay around $10 for a table with chairs and umbrella.  The restaurant will serve you on the beach.  Sit back and everything will come to you on a beach in Mexico.  Cheese pies, muffins, bread, fruit, jewelry, etc.   There are bathrooms and showers and a parking lot with attendants.  We paid 20 pesos to park.  Lots of room to spread out.  We went on a Sunday during a holiday weekend and there were a lot of people but we\'ve also been here when there was only a few people.  In any case there is room for everyone--this is a big beautiful beach and  yesterday I spotted a whale off shore and an iguana on shore.

557231171.name: Nice beach but...
557231171.author: a TripAdvisor user
557231171.reviewBody:
We were told by a staff member at our resort that we needed to check out this beach and that it was a favorite of his family. 

We took a taxi to the beach and walked down to the beach / restaurant area where we found a nice looking beach but unfortunately, the day we showed up (Wednesday January 24th) the only restaurant was closed and it appeared that they were doing plumbing work. With the restaurant closed there was no food other than a cart with fresh fruit that was tasty but not what we were there for and a guy selling beer, no restrooms for relief from the beer and no way for us to call a taxi to return to the hotel.
Well, we made the best of it and had a couple of beers and some fruit and decided we were all going to explode so walked to the road in search of a cab where there we none to be found. The security officers had no minutes on their phones and could not call for us. Luckily, we knew that the public bus cam by every 10-15 minutes and jumped on and took it to Las Cruz de Huanacaxtle where we found relief, lunch and a return taxi.

Nice place to visit but not great without the only facilities closed so make sure you have a return taxi trip planned, know how and have pesos to take the local bus and/or know for a fact that the restaurant is open. We made the best of it and it was a small learning adventure that could have been much worse.
We'll likely try it again on a future trip and I hope to be able to "up" my review once we're able to enjoy the full experience.

556586660.name: Nice sandy beach with ocean view
556586660.author: a TripAdvisor user
556586660.reviewBody: Looking for a stroll on a nice sandy beach ? Perhaps listen to the waves of the Pacific Ocean? This is the beach for you!

556206743.name: Amazing beach
556206743.author: a TripAdvisor user
556206743.reviewBody: If you like tranquility nice sand and waves ... Also a good beach for people who like long walk.\nYou are almost alone !

554109913.name: Peaceful
554109913.author: a TripAdvisor user
554109913.reviewBody: Destiladeras Beach is a beautiful white sand beach. The water allows you to wade out a distance when the tide is low. There is a parking lot and a restaurant with washroom facilities. We took the ATM Punta de Mita bus from Walmart in Puerto Vallarta for 26 pesos. It is easy to miss the sign so ask the bus driver to let you know. Buses run about 10 minutes apart.

552031334.name: Best Beach on Banderas Bay
552031334.author: a TripAdvisor user
552031334.reviewBody: Been there countless times and I would recommend it to everyone ... try it low tide and also at high tide as it provides for a very different experience.  I prefer to go during the week and in non peak tourist times.

551463563.name: Paradise!
551463563.author: a TripAdvisor user
551463563.reviewBody: This is it - long and wide white sand beach, clear blue green water, no rocks, excellent boogie boarding waves. We spent 4 hours here with a family ages 11 - 79 and all had an amazing time. Took a cab from bucerias but had to bus it back - bus leaves right at the parking lot exit. Get there early (9 or 10) - not only is the beach deserted, but the waves are excellent. The wind picks up in the afternoon and surf is choppy - plus it gets crowded by 2. The little restaurant does rent table/chairs/umbrellas for the day for $10 but the food is overpriced and mediocre. We brought umbrellas and all our gear - there is no shade so be prepared! A schlep to organize and get there (carrying back 3 boogie boards on the bus was fun) but totally worth it! Our best day in PV by far.

550263687.name: The never ending beach
550263687.author: a TripAdvisor user
550263687.reviewBody: This is our favourite beach along this stretch of the coast. It is a flat and wide beach that is almost a mile long.  Great for walking. The surf there is popular for boogie boarding and the waves gentle enough for beginners. During the week there are very few sun bathers there and it is peaceful and private.

547243120.name: Beautiful place
547243120.author: a TripAdvisor user
547243120.reviewBody: Some friends took us here to show us it was a lovely place definitely a must see,The beach was very clean and so spacious the sea was ideal for surfing .We walked the full lengthof the beach.A very lovely place was a great memory to take home.

535129971.name: Beautiful beach
535129971.author: a TripAdvisor user
535129971.reviewBody: We took an hour long bus ride from PV to get to this beach. It costs about 30 pesos per person each way. Ask the bus driver to let you know where the stop is. It is not well marked. There are umbrellas and tables for rent for about 200 pesos for the day. There is a place that sells drinks and food as well. The return bus trip was interesting as there was no bus stop and the first bus drove right past. The next one stopped at the entrance to the parking lot.probably would be beautiful at sunset but we were not sure about the bus so did not stay. There is a bit of a rip tide so keep that in mind when in the water.

483972786.name: It\'s a Beach!
483972786.author: a TripAdvisor user
483972786.reviewBody: Hey, there isn\'t much a Beach has to do to be great, but this one has extra\'s that you won\'t find at several of the other local beaches.  For one thing, you have a much more shallow beach area, so you can wade it more easily,  Most of the beaches around the area I found to have a bit of a steep approach and pretty heavy wave action so you had to have your wits about you or you would be on the bottom, on your bottom, instead of on your feet.  Very relaxing, don\'t miss it if you can!

482481849.name: Destiladeras Beach
482481849.author: a TripAdvisor user
482481849.reviewBody: Our favorite thing to do while on vacation in Puerto Vallarta was to visit the beaches. We enjoyed walking, the waves and the sunsets. Nothing beats the sunsets in Puerto Vallarta!

478851052.name: LOVE THIS BEACH!!!
478851052.author: a TripAdvisor user
478851052.reviewBody: Great for walking, boogie boarding, or sunning. My favorite beach in the bay of banderas. I highly recommend it.

471671084.name: Quiet and perfect
471671084.author: a TripAdvisor user
471671084.reviewBody: We stayed at Rancho Banderas which is right on this beach.  The beach is QUIET and perfect.  There a few other buildings along the beach, but its still very quiet.  The sand is soft, and the water is warm.  You feel like to want to walk for hours!

469420489.name: Palapa tables cost $7.50 for the day.
469420489.author: a TripAdvisor user
469420489.reviewBody:
This beach is about a 30 minute bus ride through the mountains from the Mega store bus stop which is south of Buceria.
It is a pretty beach with a bathroom for changing clothes. Food and drink available .
A sign identified the beach as public beach so we were surprised that they charge $7.50 US dollars for an umbrella table for the day.  
It was hard to swim and leave your things unattended.  
Too many hawkers selling trinkets non-stop.

462780717.name: Beautiful Nature Beach
462780717.author: a TripAdvisor user
462780717.reviewBody: This beach is not in Puerto Vallarta, it\'s about a 5 minute (Mexican Driver bus ride) north of La Cruz, good 30-35 minutes taxi ride from Puerto Vallarta. That said, it\'s a beautiful nature beach with a small restaurant and some chairs you can hire for the day. The ocean is beautiful and the beach lovely for a long walk, with very few people.\nCheers

461712482.name: Incredible beach but currently having umbrella rental issues
461712482.author: a TripAdvisor user
461712482.reviewBody:
We first encountered Destiladaras Beach in 1997. It was stunning and very untouched. You could get amazing seafood served from a little shack. Palapas were on the beach to use for free. The waves were amazing for boogie boarding or body surfing. Jump forward 20 years. The beach is still amazing but the public access is disappearing. However we have had a marvelous time returning to the beach. There is free parking that is guarded. There are tables and chairs and until yesterday, umbrellas for 150 pesos a day. The waiters from the restaurant will bring food and drink and amazingly run a tab! Food is not nearly as good as 20 years ago! 

Yesterday, we were the first people to arrive. We got our table set up and paid. Then the vendor who rents the table units started to break them down and store them away. We learned the Mexican government wants to more than double the fee for allowing them to rent umbrellas on a public beach. They vendor says it will not be a quick resolution so if you go, be prepared for no shade. 

I surely hope this beautiful beach will still be available to the public for many years to come. However, as many Mexicans have said to me, if there is enough money everything is for sale and it could become completely developed like nearby Punta de Mita.

458588094.name: Bring water shoes!!
458588094.author: a TripAdvisor user
458588094.reviewBody: Fun beach, diverse lodging options near by, coarse sand, amazing sunsets!. Some fun waves for surfing. If you do a all inclusive hotel like The Grand Palladium, your water equipment is included like boogie boards, windsurfing, surfboards, if you go on your own bring plenty of water, food and your toys because one part, the public part has no facilities. Is closer to Punta Mita than Vallarta.

455676510.name: Wonderful beach
455676510.author: a TripAdvisor user
455676510.reviewBody: Just stumbled across this beach while out driving.  I think it is the best beach in the area for walking on with soft rock free sand.  Too bad we found it on our last day there.\nThere is a very good restaurant, but we were not there for a meal, only a couple of beers.  Will definitely be back if we are in the area.

454094532.name: Best Sunset Walk!!!
454094532.author: a TripAdvisor user
454094532.reviewBody: We don\'t live too far from this big white beach, so we tend to go late in the afternoon and walk the beach.  The grandchildren love the water as the tide is going out -- you can walk for meters and meters into the water and the gentle waves.... We also tend to walk away from the music and the food and crowds.  I don\'t go on weekend afternoons, for sure.  But it\'s a favorite place -- would be great to have a nice restaurant there!

451527515.name: Back again and better than ever
451527515.author: a TripAdvisor user
451527515.reviewBody: There has been some changes to the beach that has made it so much better.  The entrance has been moved further up the road so now you have no stairs to worry about, you walk straight onto the beach.  A great restaurant to sit at or take your food to your beach chair. And now BATHROOMS.  Still one of the best beach around.

451037890.name: Great Serene beach
451037890.author: a TripAdvisor user
451037890.reviewBody: What a great find while on my stay. Very quiet, remote beach with tables, umbrellas and lounge chairs to rent.\nIt is not crowded like other beaches. Water and clear and warm.\nthere is also wait staff to bring you buckets of beer, and food.

442198582.name: BIG IMPROVEMENTS SINCE LAST YEAR
442198582.author: a TripAdvisor user
442198582.reviewBody: We take the public bus from La Cruz.  All the buses go on the Hwy 200  past the beach.  The cost is 7-9 pesos, but it is just handy and a little tip, to give 10 pesos  for the ride.  It is a beautiful short ride along the coast.  \nThey have closed the old parking lot, so you go past the resort and the driver will let you off at a area that is off the road.  You then walk just a short distance back to where the dirt driveway takes you to the parking lot.  This is above a nice restaurant.  You can rent a table for $150 pesos for the day, that is right on the beach, with a big shade umbrella.  A nice option if you don\'t want to haul a bunch of stuff.  The rental is separate from the restaurant, so many people bring their own food and drink and just rent the table.  We like to support the restaurant, because they also have outdoor showers to rinse off and clean restrooms that you can use.  They do ask for a tip, when you go into the restroom.  We have ordered beers, which are the full size, guacamole is good, and the service is excellent!  There are also other venders that sell huge fruit plates for only 50 pesos.  You can rent boogie boards for $5.00 a day.  The surf is gentle and perfect for beginners.  The beach is flat and lots of people bring their dogs.  On weekends there are loads of families, many different kind of vendors, selling their wares, giving massages, I got a henna tattoo, which was great fun.  This is a wonderful place!!   We even go out some mornings just to walk the beach and get our exercise.  \nAt this point there are not a lot of big resorts, so the beach is not crowded.  I almost don\'t want to share this review, because I don\'t want it to change or get any more known.

441376867.name: Great beach with a uncertain future
441376867.author: a TripAdvisor user
441376867.reviewBody: This is a miles long, fine, white sand beach.  And it can often be very quiet.  There are a number of access points most of which are controlled by resorts but one developer (Nahui) does provide a parking lot and reasonable access. It\'s on the old La Cruz/Pta. Mita road about 8 km north of La Cruz.  The sea can be rough at times but generally it\'s safe for swimming or wading.  It\'s not clear at this time how long the tranquillity will prevail as Nahui has plans for as many as 5000 residences on the hills above the beach.  Maybe not all built in my lifetime but will have a devastating impact on this gorgeous beach.

439839190.name: Great beach
439839190.author: a TripAdvisor user
439839190.reviewBody: One of the nicest beaches to walk,in Puerto Vallarta, it is worth the cab ride, or you can catch the bus out to it...

438740317.name: Great Sandy Beach
438740317.author: a TripAdvisor user
438740317.reviewBody: Just up the road to Puenta Mita about KM 8 is a dirt parking lot with security and a short downhill walk to a clean, sandy, beautiful beach. They rent a table with four chairs for 150 pesos a day so you can bring your own food and beverages. Also there are wait staff from the resort that will bring you food or cold drinks from their menu.  Not to busy on weekdays but weekends and holidays are so get there early. Nice Sandy Beach!

437668883.name: One of nicest walking beaches I have found
437668883.author: a TripAdvisor user
437668883.reviewBody: Clean, packed sand, sparkling water, uncrowded.  Great beach to just chill. We walked beach everyday over a mile.

437279234.name: Sand and sun
437279234.author: a TripAdvisor user
437279234.reviewBody: Beautiful beach nothing of Bucerias.  Lovely restaurants in the area.  Very reasonable prices. Many Local people use this beach.

435942198.name: best beach in nuevo vallarta
435942198.author: a TripAdvisor user
435942198.reviewBody: Beautiful pacific ocean beach just outside Nuevo Vallarta.\nBeach vendors sell food and drinks out of pallapas.\nBring your umbrella and chairs or go to the restaurant that has good lunch beach chairs and umbrellas as well as the only restrooms on the beach.

402434548.name: Go there if you can
402434548.author: a TripAdvisor user
402434548.reviewBody: This beach is more secluded and is the best beach within Banderas Bay for body boarding. Good luck entering though; the nearby hotels have put up barbed wire around what used to be the public entrance, in an illegal attempt to privatize the beach.

391586979.name: Beautiful quiet public beach
391586979.author: a TripAdvisor user
391586979.reviewBody: Spent a day here with the family  in july. Loved it. Milan the waiter was very helpful and his food was great

382517148.name: Peaceful beach
382517148.author: a TripAdvisor user
382517148.reviewBody: We felt very lucky when we stopped by and it was not very busy. The beach was beautiful and had tables you could rent for about $10 for the day. This helped having an umbrella to cool off under the sun. Nice beach for boogie boarding and body surfing. Food was reasonable and they had vendors making drinks in pineapples and selling fruit. Check it out!

381218136.name: Destileras Beach
381218136.author: a TripAdvisor user
381218136.reviewBody: Went there a few years ago, would not take small kids there as the surf is rough, but the beach is great food good

381148268.name: Sparkling beach still an adventure.
381148268.author: a TripAdvisor user
381148268.reviewBody:
Curious that there is so little development on this beach.  We first visited this beach 30 years ago and on that day you could walk out in knee high water quite a distance.  This week the tide was coming in early afternoon and the sand for walking wasn't as wide. 
 
I'm a pro photographer and wouldn't carry my full size camera while walking this beautiful
beach if the wind is strong.  While the sand is a delight to walk on, it is very fine.  I would use protection over my camera and lens because sand so fine is difficult to remove.

We will return to learn more about any public bathrooms or restaurants available. 
 
Directions by autobus:  catch a bus marked ATM.  The local mini passenger vans that run regularly along Highway 200 go to Destiladeras.  The ATM buses take the nice new side 
road and stop at a bus stop (parada) near the Nahui development and a public parking lot.  The cost was 9 or 10 pesos from La Cruz Huanacaxtle.  You may need to wait 15 minutes to return on the ATM bus.  It's a short bus ride.

365877362.name: best beach in the bay of bandras
365877362.author: a TripAdvisor user
365877362.reviewBody: this beach is the best walking beach in the bay of banceras. there is one resort on that beach.....rancho banderas. you can stop and have lunch there. beautiful beach hidden gem.

365722995.name: The nicest beach near Bucerias.
365722995.author: a TripAdvisor user
365722995.reviewBody: Spend the day there. Bring your chairs and umbrellas or rent some on the spot. The sand is fine. Be ready to swim in the waives. I have been there many times and never saw a day without waves. There is no lifeguard. During the Easter time it is quite busy. The rest of the time it is quiet. On the east part to the beach, on the other side of the rocks, some people practice nudism occasionally, but they stay away from the occupied part.

356447585.name: lovely
356447585.author: a TripAdvisor user
356447585.reviewBody: it was a lovely beach. the food was fine not excellent. the service was occassionally slow, the margarita was cold. the beach was lovely. it is also dog friendly

352751037.name: Spectacular beach
352751037.author: a TripAdvisor user
352751037.reviewBody: Visit soon as a new highway is being built to bypass this stretch of beach and a proposed resort may conceivably cut off beach access.  The beach is a long stretch of white sand with a small restaurant at the parking lot(only open til 5 pm).

351635735.name: Very MEMORABLE!
351635735.author: a TripAdvisor user
351635735.reviewBody:
We have travelled the world beach-wise, as We are beach fanatics---and 
Destiladeras Beach is certainly on  our recommended "TO-DO" list.
Highlights : A very friendly walking beach, very picturesque, interesting mix of
quality sand and varieties of colorful and porous pebbles/rock.
Terrain being unusually flat--waves are exciting, pacific - style rollers--- fun to
watch, and provide easy access. Low undertow .
This walk would be classified as being----very therapeutic.
Enjoying this area of Mexico, this beach area is a "Must-Do"!

350561763.name: Great Beach Walking and good Boogie Boarding.
350561763.author: a TripAdvisor user
350561763.reviewBody: This is a long beach that is easy to walk, with the beach area not being steep.  You can access it by public bus, just ask the driver to stop there.  I did not want any confusion, so printed out the name of the beach and just showed it to the bus driver.  From La Cruz, it can cost between 4-8pesos/person.  We found that there are fewer buses in the late afternoon to catch for the return trip home, so the wait can be longer 30min. or more.  There are no real facilities on the beach, a couple of places that sell fruit and soft drinks, so it is a bring your own stuff place, but well worth it!  Excellent for small children to play in the surf and enough of a surf for basic boogie boarding.

350374172.name: Stunning!
350374172.author: a TripAdvisor user
350374172.reviewBody: Stunning and beautiful beach near LA Cruz de Huanacaxtle. Lovely walking beach, good swimming, parking available for free, umbrellas, tables and chairs for rent reasonably. Take a snack and spend the day.

349012889.name: Beautiful Beach!
349012889.author: a TripAdvisor user
349012889.reviewBody: Another great beach day! We took the bus from our condo near Los Muertos. (transferred from the blue city bus to an ATM in front of Walmart). The whole ride took about an hour and a half.  Destiladeras was well worth the travel time!! We walked down to the restaurant to the left of the parking lot.  Which was a great choice. Excellent food!! The restaurant is located in a seperate cove so we had the beach almost to ourselves. We did venture over the hill fir a nice long walk along the beach, in and out of little coves.  It was an amazing day.

342325034.name: Watched the people on the beach from a nearby restaurant.
342325034.author: a TripAdvisor user
342325034.reviewBody: Very busy sunday but the childeren thoroughly enjoy this area as its safe with lots of inlets to play in

341246709.name: Flat wide and fabulous!
341246709.author: a TripAdvisor user
341246709.reviewBody: Not only a great beach but if you go down the dirt road to your right when you leave to get back on the road there is an excellent little restaurant where you can put your feet in the sand, order shrimp cerviche and a cold beer to cap off a great day.

327459935.name: World Class Beach
327459935.author: a TripAdvisor user
327459935.reviewBody: A stunning world class beach.  Good swimming, walking the beach, collect some shells.  Beach food is wonderful.

321039448.name: Destiladeros
321039448.author: a TripAdvisor user
321039448.reviewBody: This is the best beach in all of the PV area, our favorite place to spend a day. Great for walking, boogie boarding and swimming

303506578.name: Destilleras
303506578.author: a TripAdvisor user
303506578.reviewBody: I took a friend to Destillerderas this week. It is like the beaches in New Zealand and I play on a bogie board. Clear waters blue sky fabulous beach.

291534501.name: Best beach.
291534501.author: a TripAdvisor user
291534501.reviewBody: My husband and I have been going here every other year since 2000. Great sand, water and  not crowded.

288806763.name: Lovely beach day with local flair
288806763.author: a TripAdvisor user
288806763.reviewBody: You need to take a car of the bus there since it is North of Puerto Vallarta.   You can take a lunch or buy it there. Beach is clean and vast.  Water is clear and lovely.  They have some umbrellas but you could bring one.  Plan for the day because the fee is for the day.  It is safe and beautiful.

266051155.name: Beautiful beach
266051155.author: a TripAdvisor user
266051155.reviewBody: We always go a few times while we are down to Puerto Vallarta. It is a beautiful beach and the venders are really good. The little restaurants are really good too.

265579640.name: A Special Beach
265579640.author: a TripAdvisor user
265579640.reviewBody: It might take you a bit of effort to get here but it is well worth the bus ride! Located between  La Cruz and Punta de Mita, this soft sandy beach is somewhat wild and unspoiled. Bring your beach gear and spend a few hours here, walking the beach or sitting and watching the waves. There are some small restaurant/vendors there so you can always find something there to eat and drink!

262491633.name: Peaceful beach
262491633.author: a TripAdvisor user
262491633.reviewBody: A half-hour bus rider from downtown, this long sandy beach is a wonderful discovery:  perfect for a day away from Centro - few vendors, good restaurant, gentle surf, lots and lots of sun.

261438397.name: Amazing beach
261438397.author: a TripAdvisor user
261438397.reviewBody: Amazing beach well worth the drive out of downtown Puerto Vallarta, about 45 minutes.  It is a wonderful long beach that is quite shallow far out into the Beautiful clean water.  Good for swimming, skim boarding and bogey boarding.  You can rent a umbrella from the food vendors there that sell delicious guacamole, sea food and beer!

260612772.name: Our favorite beach in the La Cruz area
260612772.author: a TripAdvisor user
260612772.reviewBody: We LOVE this beach in the La Cruz area. Park at the top, walk down the stairs and plop yourself down! White sand is amazing. Not overly crowded or commercialized - just a couple small beach "bars" with some umbrellas and chairs to rent. Goes on forever... waves are great for bodyboarding and if the breaks aren\'t happening just soak up the sun!

259410803.name: Best beach in Banderas Bay
259410803.author: a TripAdvisor user
259410803.reviewBody: This beach is a MUST. An absolute gem that belongs on a postcard. Public, with optional umbrella and chair/table rentals. Vendors sell beverages and home-baked goods.\nWaves can be intimidating - this is a great beach for body boarding and surfing, but little ones need to stay close to shore. Sand is sublime - white and extra-fine\nTIP: Get there early and stake out a spot close to the rocky cliff for natural shade and a place to hang your wet towels and bathing suits.

258861733.name: Beautiful beach.
258861733.author: a TripAdvisor user
258861733.reviewBody: The beach was very fine sand and you could walk a long way out before reaching any depth.  The water was warm.  There is food and drink available.

258462802.name: Malecon
258462802.author: a TripAdvisor user
258462802.reviewBody: Its a beautiful walk. Lots to see and the views of the bay is stunning. \nLiked being among the locals in the city. Disliked that everything cost USD and not pesos.

258273275.name: Such a nice beach
258273275.author: a TripAdvisor user
258273275.reviewBody:
We went on a Tuesday mid-morning, and it felt like we had the beach to ourselves.
It is SOOO much better than La Manzanilla beach, it's just a few additional miles north of La Cruz.  There is absolutely no issue with being 'over-developed'; sure, there are a couple of nice hotels on the shore, but what's the problem with that?
- Beach vendors travel the shore, but aren't too pushy.  We bought some tasty desserts.
- Water is great, there is one small section with just a few rocks, so if you see that go up or down shore about 100 yards and you'll be great.
- I loved the waves, but it was nice they were breaking about 30 yards out.  It's very gradual and shallow.  So you have your choice to stay where it's calm, or move out into the fun.
- Sand was great, you can walk at least 30 minutes.
- Great views of the cliffs.
GREAT!

257696466.name: Great Beach Day
257696466.author: a TripAdvisor user
257696466.reviewBody: Great place to spend the day playing in the ocean!!  There is a small bar there you can buy drinks at our rent an umbrella and table for the day.  The water was beautiful!\n\n

256619971.name: Beautiful, expansive beach ... great for whale watching
256619971.author: a TripAdvisor user
256619971.reviewBody: A short drive from La Cruz, this beach is beautiful and not yet spoiled by development and tourism. This is a great place for whale watching and soaking up some rays. There is a lovely breeze to keep you comfortable. Parking is easy and safe (just pay a few pesos when you leave). There are a couple of very small places to buy beverages and fresh fruit, but probably best to pack a picnic if you\'re staying for the day like we did.

252486060.name: Absolutely beautiful beach...
252486060.author: a TripAdvisor user
252486060.reviewBody: We spent a marvelous day hiking the beach and swimming.  The small cabanas where you buy fish or fruit drinks are well worth enjoying.  The water is warm and the waves are easy.  Not too many tourists come to the beach which makes it a delightful place to spend the day.  This year we will try and take the bus back and forth.  Hopefully it will work out for us.

252131459.name: Best Beach on the Bay
252131459.author: a TripAdvisor user
252131459.reviewBody: Great place to whale watch.  Great place to walk the beach - you can go fo miles on flat sand if the tide is out.

248124242.name: Great beach
248124242.author: a TripAdvisor user
248124242.reviewBody: About 40 stairs you have to walk down to get to the beach.  Chairs, you can rent and umbrellas. Bus drops you off at the top.

248031459.name: Sadly Ruined by Developers
248031459.author: a TripAdvisor user
248031459.reviewBody: The was our FAVORITE beach for many years - but developers have run off the folks who had the little restuarant and have limited access to the beach.  It USED to be free and fun and safe - we\'ve spent days there.  We returned a few months ago and didn\'t hardly recognize it - it was a sad experience.  Beaches in Mexico are ALL open to the public - by law - however ACCESS is often limited by the big hotels and resorts - very sad.  Skip it.

242475062.name: Expansive beach
242475062.author: a TripAdvisor user
242475062.reviewBody: A fantastic beach to body surf and enjoy the lovely bay. You can catch a bus from Walmart (on the hi-way side) to get to the beach, ask the driver to stop for you as it is a bit remote. You can walk out for a long ways to body surf

242372505.name: Wow
242372505.author: a TripAdvisor user
242372505.reviewBody: If you want to see lots of ocean and powder sand then this is the place.There r food venders there for food and drink.They will charge u to use there\'re chairs.

241035162.name: Washed out! So sad!
241035162.author: a TripAdvisor user
241035162.reviewBody: This was one of the best "locals" beaches in the Bay and surrounding coastline but the recent heavy hurricane season destroyed it! Before that it was great to walk on, swim in the ocean, eat at the clean vendors spots, watched the whales etc. Hopefully, they can do some repairs and have it back for the winter. Check with a reputable local tour company on the conditions before heading there.

238062062.name: Beautiful but...
238062062.author: a TripAdvisor user
238062062.reviewBody: Destiladeras has been one of our favorite beaches since 1992 but sometimes it gets dirty...folks don\'t clean up their trash.  I don\'t like that.  Sundays are family days at all of the beaches, when families pack up food, all the kids/relatives, and go to the beaches, and this is one of the busiest on Sunday. If you are looking for solitude, maybe try this one on a weekday.\n

234957168.name: amazingly beautiful
234957168.author: a TripAdvisor user
234957168.reviewBody: This beach is no longer a secret, but you can still enjoy a long walk on the most beautiful beach on the bay.  We love walking our little dog in the waves.  Be careful boogie boarding as there can sometimes be a strong undertow!

234884077.name: hidden gem
234884077.author: a TripAdvisor user
234884077.reviewBody: We found this place through a recommendation from a local on the bus who said this beach was his favorite in the area. About a 45 minute busride from our hotel in puerto vallarta (buses are super cheap and very convenient, just tell the bus driver you\'re going to destiladeras and he\'ll tell you when to get off). the ocean is turqoise blue, far more so than the beaches near the hotel strip and when we went there were only 7 or so other people on the entire beach (all locals). we got a bit of shade under a shelter but it\'s not too walkable to restaurants or stores so bring enough water with you! (we had to leave early we got so thirsty, rookie mistake.) \ntake a walk along it\'s length to find some great crags and tidal pools... the beach sits beneath a bluff and the bus\'ll let you off right at the edge of it.\none of my favorite parts of our entire trip to puerto vallarta.

228128879.name: Beach of dreams
228128879.author: a TripAdvisor user
228128879.reviewBody: Beautiful long beach. Quiet and peaceful. Cant wait to visit again. There was a young boy diving for oysters. We were able to sid on this deserted beach and have fresh oysters and cold beer. What more could a person ask for.

223622580.name: Most beautiful beach in Bahia de Banderas
223622580.author: a TripAdvisor user
223622580.reviewBody: The beach itself is big and beautiful.I\'m dreaming of that blue water all over again! I love playa Destiladeras!!

216924540.name: The best beach in the area
216924540.author: a TripAdvisor user
216924540.reviewBody: i liked this place so much, better than Sayulita Beach or Guayabitos, u can see fishes thru the water, and nice water nuances, you can eat fresh coctails and ceviche or aguachile, local people, families, perfect for kids and pets, to hang with friends, the beverages are expensive take yours, and ice... i liked  a lot.

208214913.name: Remarkable beach
208214913.author: a TripAdvisor user
208214913.reviewBody: Perhaps the nicest beach I was fortunate enough to enjoy in Bah\u00eda de Banderas (Banderas Bay)... its clear shallow waters and wide sandy areas make it an ideal spot for swimming, playing, and relaxing during the day. You can purchase coconuts and refreshments around the entrance. It\'s a clean and long stretch of walkable shore; therefore, if it gets too crowded, just keeping wandering in one direction, while taking in the beautiful scenery, until you arrive at THE spot. Watching a sunset here is... wow!

205611693.name: The best public beach!
205611693.author: a TripAdvisor user
205611693.reviewBody: Destiladeras Beach has taken a new name. It is now called Nahui but all the locals still show up each weekend. Great sandy beach perfect for the family! WE actually fulfilled our vacation goal this year---we walked the beach EVERY day!

197881081.name: march the 6 will never be the same for me
197881081.author: a TripAdvisor user
197881081.reviewBody: the beach is one of the best in mexico  ans iwas a life guard as a Young man and still a strong \nswimmer.had a unique chance to help out a guy in distress at sea. and the best time for us we have a boxer  so was 10 am  the beach was ours and we could let the dog play a lot. Next years will be there for sure

195884132.name: Most beautiful beach in the area
195884132.author: a TripAdvisor user
195884132.reviewBody: Tucked in between La Cruz and Punta Mita this is the place to be.  Cliffs overlooking an almost virgin beach. But it is starting to get developed so get there soon.

195790417.name: Fabulous beach
195790417.author: a TripAdvisor user
195790417.reviewBody: Outstanding beach. No toilets. Must pay 150 pesos for an umbrella and chairs plus drinks and food. Better if you have a car to get there.Otherwise, you must take a bus.

195225559.name: Hidden treasure
195225559.author: a TripAdvisor user
195225559.reviewBody: A 60 pecos bus ride from Bucerias gets you to this lovely beach. Fine sand and clear, clean water compared to inside Banderas Bay. Beach huts for food and drink, bring your towel and rent a table/chairs for 15.00 for the day. Walk for miles in each direction.

194321304.name: Fabulous Beach
194321304.author: a TripAdvisor user
194321304.reviewBody: A 40-year veteran of Puerto Vallarta let us in on the secret of this wonderful beach. We\'re staying on the South Shore, so it was a good drive to get there, but it was worth it ..... beautiful, wide sand beach, easily several miles long. Destileraderas is on the road sign as you drive north out of La Cruz, but it doesn\'t come up again. The parking is at a sign for Nahui Bay, which was about 5 km after leaving La Cruz. We went on a Saturday and were charged 50 pesos for parking -- perhaps it\'s free during the week. There were vendors charging 350 pesos to rent an umbrella and some simple beach restaurants close by the steps down from the parking lot. We went further on up the beach where it was much quieter. What a great view of the bay and with lots of whale activity. We had delicious fresh fish ceviche and cold beer at a small beach bar operated by one of the (fortunately) still very small developments. The swimming was great -- a calm day, not too bad undertow and only a very gradual deepening of water. I hope we get back there again this winter.

193378493.name: Great beach
193378493.author: a TripAdvisor user
193378493.reviewBody: This beach is not marked "destiladeras" by any road signs on site.  Coming from the east, you can park for free at the first sign for a resort called Nahui.  Watch the speed bump coming in, as we got a flat from it.  Parking is on a large unpaved surface.\n\nThis beach is wide and long and beautiful, with bigger waves than the nearby Manzanilla beach in la Cruz.  Finer sand, too.  By noon, there are food and drink servers, and other purveyors.   Food and drink choices are more limited than manzanilla, but are still good, and not extortionate.  New condos are coming up toward the west, with a sitdown lunch spot about 800 meters from the east parking lot.  I don\'t think this development has ruined this site, as others contend--well, not yet, at least.  Some portable potties were being delivered when we left, at around 1:30.  At 10 AM, this beach was absolutely deserted, on a Friday.

190338570.name: Best Beach north of Puerto Vallarta
190338570.author: a TripAdvisor user
190338570.reviewBody: We have been coming to Rancho Banderas and Playa Destiladeras for 15 years.  It is the best beach up north, stretching for over a mile.  The fish restaurant on the beach makes incredible Zarandeado - the local preparation for whole grilled fish, as well shrimp on a stick.\nThere are also fruit vendors as well as a \'bar\' on the beach.

188665077.name: North Shore
188665077.author: a TripAdvisor user
188665077.reviewBody: If you\'re in the very touristy north shore area, don\'t miss this gem!  It\'s (unlike many others) NOT an all-inclusive.....open to all who treasure the beautiful Banderas Bay shoreline.  New restaurants are open...a great place to put your toes in the sand.

184419870.name: This beach was the reason we moved here!
184419870.author: a TripAdvisor user
184419870.reviewBody: This is the premier beach on the Banderas Bay. Several miles of white sand, fabulous surf, no treacherous drop offs. This beach is a beach combers delight. You can still get a cold beer from one of the vendors and some food. The area is in the process of development, being the best beach in the area. Sadly, the beach will probably be closed to public access when they move the road that passes by the beach. If this happens, Banderas Bay will have lost it\'s crown jewel.

181525300.name: Pristine white sandy beaches
181525300.author: a TripAdvisor user
181525300.reviewBody: We love stopping here for a walk on one of the most beautiful strips of beach we ever been on. Quiet is the key as access is rather limited unless you stop at one of the resorts or restaurants along the beach but soooo worth the visit.

179711189.name: Don\'t Miss Out...
179711189.author: a TripAdvisor user
179711189.reviewBody: This is probably one of the best, most private and uncrowded beaches in the bay, but soon to disappear to the developers.   I watched in horror as the same thing happened at Punta de Mita, which is no more for the average person.   Now it\'s more or less for the priviliged, rich golf crowd.  I used to luxuriate in the sun all day long out there years ago...they had nice little restaurant/beach houses and great beach chairs with shades on the top.   Now it\'s a conglomeration of gated condo communities.   I fear the same will happen at Destiladeras, so dont miss out....see  it and spend a day there before it, too, is gone to the developers.   It\'s one of the few remaining uncrowded beaches left in the entire Bahia de Banderas.

178732281.name: One of the best kept secrets
178732281.author: a TripAdvisor user
178732281.reviewBody:
Destiladeras is one of our favourite places to go but we only share it with our best friends - because we don't want it to become too popular!  If you visit on weekdays you may be the only people there or sharing it with a few other lucky ones. 

The restaurant located at the south end of the beach is a great place to start by enjoying a leisurely delicious lunch while watching the whales. I can recommend the Coconut Shrimp. Go for a stroll along the mile of beautiful sandy beach or enjoy a swim and wave jumping in the surf. There are also a few food vendors on the beach or you can simply rent a lounge chair and order a cerveza from them if you just want to sit and gaze at the waves.

Sundays and Holidays, Destiladeras belongs to the local mexican families who flock there in thousands to enjoy their own brand of barbecue, bands and la playa. We visited one Easter Friday and were immersed in a fabulous experience of the mexican holiday at the beach spirit.

Unfortunately, there is a new development that will eventually absorb Destiladeras Beach so get there while you can still enjoy its beauty.

178664427.name: "Nice beach"
178664427.author: a TripAdvisor user
178664427.reviewBody: first time to visit this place so nice... the unforgettable moment with my friends... this beach is awesome, have a clean bay, have a fresh cool air...and surely your stress will all gone... enjoyable... ^_^

178215290.name: Best beach in the Bay
178215290.author: a TripAdvisor user
178215290.reviewBody: The beach is never crowded as it is off the beaten path en route to punta de mita...soft light coloured sand....very long wide beach....good swimming, body surfing, very rustic!

170218784.name: Destiladeras
170218784.author: a TripAdvisor user
170218784.reviewBody: It used to be our favorite but they built condos and time shares there.  It is still beautiful but the quiet serenity is gone, too many americans there now,

165374663.name: It is gone but not forgotten
165374663.author: a TripAdvisor user
165374663.reviewBody: It was our favorite beach North of PV.  Secluded, clean and a wonderful day trip.  There was one restaurant and good food and drink.  Last time we went two years ago it was all gone - a developer was building and the restaurant was gone.  VERY SAD!

159624433.name: Tranquilclean, great beach
159624433.author: a TripAdvisor user
159624433.reviewBody: you can walk way out, into the water,see bottom,or just sit in the water near the beach, and enjoy the life,dream, read a book...\nlife couldnt get any better(that is what we dream about all winter)

153781493.name: prettiest beach on the bay!
153781493.author: a TripAdvisor user
153781493.reviewBody: This has always been a favorite of ours since we first came to PV in the 70\'s.  The road is much better now, making the drive from PV easier.  The wide white sand beach is perfect for walking for miles!  We love taking our little dog to play here.

153475904.name: Day trip to Destiladeras Beach with the ride
153475904.author: a TripAdvisor user
153475904.reviewBody: We took the Punta Mita bus from Wal-mart. Tell the bus drive where you want to get off - this is a regular stop. It is past La Cruz before you get to Punta Mita. The beach has beautiful sand, rugged clifs and great waves. It is very private. There are chairs to rent and outdoor toilets, but  to the south I recommend lunch or breakfast at a new place that just opened call Nahui. We had smoked fish tacos that were delish. They have a bathroom and showers for guests.

153411454.name: It is going to change
153411454.author: a TripAdvisor user
153411454.reviewBody: My third visit to walk that long beach, collect shells and watch for life in the rock pools. But the old restaurant on the beach has gone. Plans for a condo community are in the works and the peace and quiet of the area will be gone. But it is too beautiful not to share. However a new restauant has arrived and we sat looking out to sea and had a wonderful display from spouting whales, flapping and diving. We didn\'t even have to go in a boat. Only a 20 pesos bus ride from the Walmart bus station.

153138893.name: Beautiful secluded beach !
153138893.author: a TripAdvisor user
153138893.reviewBody: This is a little known beach amoung tourists and probably the finest beach on Banderas Bay. Soft powdery sand, long flat beach, great for walking and great veiws of whales off shore.

152270547.name: Great day
152270547.author: a TripAdvisor user
152270547.reviewBody: Our extended family had the best day at this beach.  Great weather and waves to go with it.  \nWe\'ll definitely be back...Food, chairs boogie boards available for purchase or rent, or you can bring your own!!!

150751814.name: The best beach on the bay.
150751814.author: a TripAdvisor user
150751814.reviewBody: Destiladeras beach is by far the nicest beach on Banderas Bay.  The fine sand makes it easy to walk on and the bay and mountain views are outstanding.  We just returned from a two week vacation and we saw whales in the bay everyday.  If you are not staying on the beach, it is a short drive from Nuevo Vallarta or you can take the ATM towards Punta Mita.  Get off at KM 7 (sign for Nahui) and walk down to the beach.  If you are driving, there is a charge to park.  It is a little remote, so expect to have the beach pretty much to yourself.\n\nThere are a couple of Mexican food huts where they serve food, fresh fruit (the fresh pineapple is the best) and cold cervesas.   Plan to be there near low tide and you can walk the beach for miles.  There are a couple of portable toilets although we never used them because we were staying just up the beach.  If you are planning on spending most of the day, be sure to bring an umbrella and plenty of sun screen because the beach faces the south and you get sunlight all day long.

150491852.name: best beach in the bay
150491852.author: a TripAdvisor user
150491852.reviewBody: it you are looking to get away from the crowds and everyone this beach is it\nyou have to drive out to punta mita but its worth it

150140291.name: It doesn\'t get any better!
150140291.author: a TripAdvisor user
150140291.reviewBody: Miles of spectacular white sand beach caressed by turquoise blue waters. A great spot that local Mexicans enjoy on Sundays, which is family day and a interesting place to walk and see the beautiful beach front homes

148161686.name: TRIPADVISOR you need to see a map of Mexico!
148161686.author: a TripAdvisor user
148161686.reviewBody: Puerto Vallarta is located in the state of Jalisco.\nDestiladeras Beach is in the state of Nayarit, so it is part of Riviera Nayarit.

147434591.name: No words
147434591.author: a TripAdvisor user
147434591.reviewBody: Beautiful beach so big, you can walk for miles and miles the only down side is that it is quite windy, be sure to put a lot of cream. Nice little restauant right on the beach, tables and chairs available for renting.

146457364.name: gorgeous
146457364.author: a TripAdvisor user
146457364.reviewBody: stayed here 3 years ago at rancho banderas my fave resort in the area, then have been back twice just for the beach experience. For $3 you can get a pineapple filled with fruit, $8 more an umbrella, table and chairs for your white gringo self to stay shaded. We love it for the kids and lack of structure and high rises. Unfortunately I bet it will be developed in 10 years but for now, we love it  as well as Litabu down the road

145992933.name: A peaceful spot
145992933.author: a TripAdvisor user
145992933.reviewBody: A huge expanse of beach with great waves for boogie boarding.  You can rent an umbrella or set up on your own.

144341307.name: beatiful ,clean beach
144341307.author: a TripAdvisor user
144341307.reviewBody: not many vendors invading your space, quiet, except for the wonder ocean sounds crashing. food is outstanding from several great restaurants close to the beach

136931643.name: BEAUTIFUL
136931643.author: a TripAdvisor user
136931643.reviewBody: Almost deserted in the morning but it\'s not a secret beach anymore. The water was SOO clear and beautiful!  We ordered a Sea Food platter right  there under our umbrella and together with a bucket of beers it was like we were in a commercial!

136772943.name: WONDERFUL beach
136772943.author: a TripAdvisor user
136772943.reviewBody: In my opinion, this is the nicest beach I have ever been to.  So quite, beautiful white sand, endless beach.  The water is clear, you can see your feet.  Mexico\'s beach at his best.  Once you have been to that beach, you realized that Mexico has nothing to envy to Cuba\'s beaches.

135065996.name: Best beach to the north
135065996.author: a TripAdvisor user
135065996.reviewBody: This is by far the best beach north of Bucerias that the bay has to offer. Not too much to offer for food so you might want to bring your own but the beach in 100%.

132470990.name: great beach
132470990.author: a TripAdvisor user
132470990.reviewBody: Compacted sand that makes walking a breeze. Long stretches that are quiet, especially on weekdays. Some good restaurants along the way including Peppers at Rancho Banderas. Good waves for boogie boarding and swimming is easy as well. By Rancho there is a good 2-3 mile stretch that is a joy to stroll down. Very few vendors to deal with. A couple of smaller eateries where the Corona is cold and the fish fresh.

131382309.name: This Beach is is Beautiful
131382309.author: a TripAdvisor user
131382309.reviewBody: This beach is not closed visited it last week. One of the best in all of Puerto Vallarto. I Have visited most of the beaches and this is one not  to be missed. Not many Places to dine.But truly a great beach to walk.

125548395.name: was a fab beach
125548395.author: a TripAdvisor user
125548395.reviewBody: unfortunatley a developer has pretty much closed this beach to the public ;-(

124974143.name: Very good Food
124974143.author: a TripAdvisor user
124974143.reviewBody: A very large beach, with great waves to surf, but the sand its so clean. They have excelent restaurants with great food and a very good prices

122663445.name: Breathtakingly Beautiful
122663445.author: a TripAdvisor user
122663445.reviewBody: I can say that I\'m a beach lover and as such have checked them out where ever I\'ve travelled.  The beach that remains on the top of my list is Destiladeras Beach on the way to Punta de Mita and is part of the Bay of Banderas.  It doesn\'t have fantastic facilities, in fact you could drive right by it as it isn\'t marked and the parking lot is a smal dirt lot, but for me that just adds to the charm.  When you make your way down the stairs to the beach you are greeted with an expanse of powdery white sand and rolling waves and more often than not just a very few fellow beach lovers.  You can rent chairs and umbrellas if you like but we prefer to wander our way down the beach and stop for lunch by the pool at Los Veneros Beach Club.  To me this makes up the perfect day!

119521133.name: Beautiful day-trip from PV, not to be missed.
119521133.author: a TripAdvisor user
119521133.reviewBody: Whenever I am in Puerto Vallarta area, one day is set aside to get to this beautiful beach. A short ride (by cab or bus) usually drops you roadside to walk past the stone arch entrance sign and down the driveway to this out-of-the-way oasis. A broad area of thatched roof and numerous assorted palapas adorn the beach. Waves wash upon beautiful sloping sand (very often great for boogie-boarding). Those who wish to walk the beach can go miles up and down. Yes, there are areas of rocky coast breaking up the wide sand which prevails.
