These afford the obsevant hiker a chance to view a variety of sea life (crabs, snails, etc). I highly recommend having a meal while here. Frankly, meals here have been the most memorable parts of my trips to PV -- absolutely excellent food, under a palapa on a rather secluded beach -- it doesn\'t get much better than this.

119162645.name: nicest in area minus all the rocks
119162645.author: a TripAdvisor user
119162645.reviewBody: This is a very nice beach and we visited it today and I think that because of Hurricane Jova or the time of year in October that we are here there is alot of rocks and the bottom is uncertain goes from shallow to deep ....The water is more blue and very clear compared to La Cruz beach and Bucerias .....you take the first turn off of the highway for public access and a steep climb down...not for faint of heart .... lots and lots of rocks that hurt your feet but they are spaced out so you can dodge them ...not like the beach at La cruz just before La manzanilla .....normally apparantly there are no rocks ...it is very long and you would have to walk a very very long way to get to other parts of this beautiful beach ...definately worth the afternoon we took to go look at it ...there looks to be some places to eat on the beach but closed up and secured awaiting the hurricane tommorrow ...The  beach at Bucerias is also very very nice .......there are coves of stones but sandy in between as you go further towards La Cruz ......we liked the swimming to at Bucerias but the nicest water color and whitish sand is at this beach Destiladeras !!

117231308.name: Best Beach in the Area!
117231308.author: a TripAdvisor user
117231308.reviewBody: I live 6 months a year at Punta Esmeralda La Cruz.  This beach is hands down, wide open, always a great breeze ( picks up later in the afternoon) awesome boogie boarding beach.  unfortunately a huge development will be taking it over soon which is such a shame.  if you love to boogie board, eat great mexican BBQ, enjoy this beach!

116211423.name: Terrible bug bites
116211423.author: a TripAdvisor user
116211423.reviewBody:
First let me say the town and residents of Puerta Vallarta are fabulous.  BUT~
if you travel to Puerta Vallarta or Nueva Vallarta be aware of the time of year you are traveling... Tropical climate...the Awesome rain forest  dumps into the ocean along the beach making the water dirty.  bug bites are aweful, take Off! Snakes slither in and out of the ocean along the beach.  
On the flip side, if you can get  to one of the surrounding areas the water does clear up for snorkleing but you must drive or travel by  boat.  
Beautiful area, delicious, authentic Mexican food and shopping.

90669877.name: Nicest beach in Nayarit...
90669877.author: a TripAdvisor user
90669877.reviewBody:
We lucked into this gem thanks to our neighbors in Bucerias. We caught the Punta Mita bus and got off at Mile Marker 7... and there it was. We were there mid-week so it was very quiet. We walked for miles without seeing anyone. Finally stopped near Rancho Banderas, a time-share/condo/hotel halfway down the beach. 

This is one of the few "flat" beaches in the area. A very safe and friendly swim beach. Waves are big enough to have fun, but basically no undertow.

Because the hotel wan't busy, they allowed us to come up and use the bar/restaurant. In fact, the treated us like guests. Very friendly folks. Apparently there's a deal for $300 pesos a day you can use the facilities... pool, beach chairs, washrooms, bar/restaurant. We may try this when we go back in Feb.

If you're in the area, give Destiladeras a try. It's a very cool beach experience!

6269845.name: getaway..still some spots left
6269845.author: a TripAdvisor user
6269845.reviewBody: we discovered this great little piece of paradise five years ago and make a point of visiting everytime we go to p/v or bucerias\n

1719113.name: Paradise found
1719113.author: a TripAdvisor user
1719113.reviewBody: A pristine and very friendly beach that can be reached by bus from Sam\'s club. Beautiful, gentle rolling waves, boogie boards and a simple restaurant. No buildings visible except a giant palapa. My favorite beach.

667026264.name: A Beautiful Sailing Trip with Whale Watching
667026264.author: a TripAdvisor user
667026264.reviewBody: We went whale watching with Captain Justin at Bahia Sailing Tours aboard the Ocean Light, a 71-foot wooden sailboat built in 1987. Captain Justin and his mate, Jonathan, showed us a great time \u2013 they were kind, compassionate, and most of all competent. They provided kid-sized lifejackets for the kids, which was essential. We first went to a spot for snorkeling and while the swimming was not difficult, as the boat was anchored in a fairly-protected cove, the sighting of fish was not good, as this time of year the bay is kind of beat-up so the water is very cloudy. We managed to see some angelfish and starfish, but not too much else. When the 4-year old got seasick, Captain Justin was right there with a bucket and towels and reassuring words both for the little girl and her mother! \n\nWe then set sail and went around the bay. While we knew that it was late in the year for whale watching, somehow Captain Justin found them and we watched a great show for about 20 minutes. They were pretty far from the boat but nonetheless we were able to see them breach and see the huge splashes. There was much cheering and shouting during the display. None of us had been on a sailboat before so it was great to watch Justin and Jonathan work the sails and deal with the wind and waves. After our 4-hour adventure we returned to the marina through really choppy and windy conditions so it became even more of an adventure. Once in the marina, Jonathan served his homemade ceviche, or should I say, boat-made ceviche. This was a great time and I would definitely sail with Captain Justin again.

666948433.name: Fun on the water!
666948433.author: a TripAdvisor user
666948433.reviewBody: Justin and Jonathan were great hosts aboard their beautiful 70 sloop. Relaxed and inviting yet firm and polite when handling the boat, they offer a great way to experience the waters of Bahia de Bandera, surrounding Puerto Vallarta.  Light food and plenty of drinks are supplied during your cruise and you can relax and take in the sun, water, whales and views or be as involved with the sailing as you want. Can\'t recommend this cruise, enough!

661897980.name: Felt like you had your own private ship!
661897980.author: a TripAdvisor user
661897980.reviewBody: Justin and Jonathan were great!  It was a very chill experience.  We had a total of 6 on the boat, who were all in our party, but this boat would be very comfortable with two to three times the amount of guests.  We were never without a beverage in hand and the lunch was simple, but excellent.  Captain Justin was great in making sure that our trip included close up views of whales, while not overly infringing on their space.  \nFor those seeking the "booze cruise" experience, this probably isn\'t the ship for you, but if you are looking for a true sailing experience that really makes you feel like you\'re out with friends and family, this trip can\'t be beat!  We plan to make it a regular part of our return visits to Bucerias.   Craig (Bend, Oregon)

661191686.name: Who\'s the Captain - On this boat you can be for awhile and Sail yourself
661191686.author: a TripAdvisor user
661191686.reviewBody: I took my wife with daughter and son-in-law for day on the bay.  Turned out this trip was Private boat just for us, but plenty of room for more. We found whales all over, drank good beverages (more with alcohol) and ate good late lunch with snacks. We have tried other more crowded trips and found this to be the best and worth the short drive to LaCruz. Justin & crew let me Captain the boat for as long as I was willing to sail standing behind the wheel making my experience the best especially tacking into the wind and looking for whales by family on the bow. We will do this again only longer. Jim U

658716296.name: Whale Watching and Truly Sailing
658716296.author: a TripAdvisor user
658716296.reviewBody: Are you looking to get away from the tourist crowds?  Don\'t want the booze cruise? Want a more relaxed, private, personal experience?  This is your tour!  We had a wonderful experience with captain Justin and Jonathan.  We saw lots of whales, sailed and had great service and a great lunch.  Yes they serve beer, wine and simple cocktails, but truly this is about getting on the water and relaxing and enjoying beimg on the ocean.  Loved it!  Will return for sure!

656880861.name: Magnifico!
656880861.author: a TripAdvisor user
656880861.reviewBody: Four of us wanted a day on the water, We were originally thinking Isla Mariettas but found this Instead. Justin and Johnathan were excellent hosts,  Within the first hall hour a whale and her calf surfaced very close to us     What an amazing day, very relaxing, excellent margaritas and fresh delicious  lunch prepared on board by Johnathon.   We started cruise with fresh orange juice, moored out near Punta Mita where they dropped anchor for us to en joy paddleboarding or just swimming    This is a beautiful sail boat, not a party boat!  It was just the 4 of us plus a crew of 2  After lunch we had a relaxing sail back to La Cruz   my advice is DO IT!!

656653449.name: Highly Recommend!!!
656653449.author: a TripAdvisor user
656653449.reviewBody: Our family of 7 joined Justin and Jonathan for a whale watching sail. Saw many dolphin and whales and they were so close! Jonathan serves great drinks/lunch and Justin is very informative! Unfortunately, we had a minor medical emergency (not related in any way to being on the boat), so we had to cut our day short. Despite that we still had a great time, and will definitely do it again when back to the area!! I highly recommend anyone thinking about it to just contact Justin and book it!!!!

655855245.name: Terrific day of sailing in the Banderas Bay
655855245.author: a TripAdvisor user
655855245.reviewBody: We loved our day of sailing with captain and owner Justin and his first mate Jonathan who were excellent hosts! We saw lots of dolphins, whales and turtles, plus great snorkeling at Los Arcos.  Highly recommend this tour. They often have small groups - on this tour it was just the five of us so if you hate the crowded party boat scene this is the tour to take. Lots of great drinks and tasty lunch. Also they can personalize your day of sailing so you really feel you\'re on a private tour.  Thanks guys for a fabulous day!

653740030.name: Excellent experience
653740030.author: a TripAdvisor user
653740030.reviewBody: We had a terrific time aboard the Ocean Light for a four hour sailing trip. Crew were awesome and the boat was well equipped. Definitely recommended!!!

652442370.name: Another great day on the Ocean Light
652442370.author: a TripAdvisor user
652442370.reviewBody: This was my second time I put my foot on the deck of this beautiful sail boat!\nI think it speaks for itself !. It was a fantastic trip with awesome food and great service.\nKeep up good work captain Justin and Johnathan. If good winds will push to the PV in the future I will be on your boat ! I promise ! Pleasure to meet you.

650764897.name: An awesome afternoon sail!
650764897.author: a TripAdvisor user
650764897.reviewBody: We spent a fabulous afternoon sailing on this beautiful sailboat.  Saw whales and a huge turtle.  Very relaxing trip with Captain Justin and crew Jonathan.  We were well looked after and it was a great way to see the bay.  Would highly recommend!Q!

650534351.name: A fabulous day sail on Bahia Banderas
650534351.author: a TripAdvisor user
650534351.reviewBody: Banderas Bay is fabulous. To really experience it you have to get out on the water and Bahia Sailing is the best way to do that. Captain Justin Liddy met us at the dock, got us settled and going right away. We went out to Punta Mita and were fortunate to have good sailing wind in both directions, out in the morning and back in the afternoon. (Can\'t expect that every day!) Spotted 7-8 pairs of humpbacks. A red footed booby landed on the rail and stayed with us for a while. Mate Jonathan served up some excellent ceviche and pico for lunch. The Ocean Light can hold a number of passengers but that day it was only my wife and I and one other. ((Can\'t expect that every time either.) At the end of the cruise we even mingled with the weekly sailboat racers as we neared the marina. All in all a great day sail and highly recommended.

647676861.name: Whale Watching
647676861.author: a TripAdvisor user
647676861.reviewBody: Spent a fabulous day with Justin and Johnathon. The wooden sailboat is gorgeous, well cared for and something to be proud of. We saw so many Humpback Whales and Justin stayed a respectable distance away yet close enough for us to be amazed by these gigantic animals. Johnathon was extremely knowledgeable about the whales\u2019 habits, as well as the local birds and dolphins. Great food, drinks and conversation all made for a perfect day.

643315468.name: Amazing day in the Bah\u00eda
643315468.author: a TripAdvisor user
643315468.reviewBody: Great service and a friendly and professional crew with Cap\u2019t Justin and crew Johnathan and Julio. Trip around the bay was great, saw plenty of Humpbacks and even a rare Orca. The snorkeling was fantastic and the beaches were beautiful. Highly recommended.

641876289.name: A great day at sea!
641876289.author: a TripAdvisor user
641876289.reviewBody:
We were very fortunate to spend the day with Justin and his first mate Jonathon on Ocean Light.  Due to a cancellation, we had the entire boat to ourselves. But at 71', there is plenty of room aboard for even bigger groups.

Morning winds are light so we motored to Punta Nina, paddle boarding snorkelling or simply relaxing on the expansive deck awaits.  Jonathon makes a great first mate and steward and welcomed yea back onboard with a great lunch and a nice cold Pacifico.

Setting course for Marietas Islands we encountered some whales and many water taxis heading out for the "turn and burn" tours of the secret beach.  Like clockwork, the afternoon breezes filled in around 1 pm and the sails were set for a fantastic reach back to the marina in La Cruz.  Besides the smooth comfortable sailing, we crossed paths with maybe 100 dolphins including babies coming over to say hi!  The highlight of our day was a spectacular display from a group of 3 humpback whales splashing, breaching many many times!!  

All-in this trip is highly recommended.  Experienced crew, fabulous safe wooden boat and Baderas Bahia scenery.  Male this trip a must do on your next Puerto Vallarta vacation!!

Great job Justin and Jonathon.

641194973.name: Great sail and snorkle
641194973.author: a TripAdvisor user
641194973.reviewBody: Captain Justin and crew Jonathan are the best.  For a minimal fee we got a great sail and snorkle trip plus booze and great food prepared by Jonathan.  Nice to meet you both.  Cheers from Colorado!  Kevin and family.

639481745.name: Fantastic !
639481745.author: a TripAdvisor user
639481745.reviewBody: Best sunset tour we have ever done . The guys who took us captain Justin and jonathon were the best . We got to see so many whales and dolphins too. The guys were the best they could not do enough to make our trip exceptional . Would highly recommend  these guys to anyone wanting to take a sailing tour . They are the best

617941808.name: Totally Amazing
617941808.author: a TripAdvisor user
617941808.reviewBody: Great day!! Top Notch Service! A must for a relaxing day. Lunch was fabulous. Captain and crew made sure everybody were taken care of at all times

613228686.name: Amazing day!!!
613228686.author: a TripAdvisor user
613228686.reviewBody: Thanks to all Bahia Sailing crew for this unforgetable adventure in the ocean!!  i will remember this forever!!!! I recommend it 100% they have the best party! We also saw dolphins my favorite animals!! <3

612414553.name: If you want to sail with pirates. Goooo furthered!
612414553.author: a TripAdvisor user
612414553.reviewBody: Oceano, fiesta, reglas basicas, confianza, duela de madera, aventura, carcajadas, seguridad, tormenta, tortugas, clavados, nadadita, tragos coquetos, discrecion. What are you waithig for! An adventure that I achieved in my mind for ever.

612413020.name: The best experience I\'ve ever had in the sea!!
612413020.author: a TripAdvisor user
612413020.reviewBody: Perfect weather, sail to PV had a great time drinks, wonderful service, paddles on board... we got to see 2 or 3 turtles  and several dolphins along the way... the best part was on our way back when a storm reached and lift the sails and made this experience the most unique... very safe and the crew trained and capable... good snacks and top shelf drinks... awesome thank you!!!

611579285.name: Perfect Day!
611579285.author: a TripAdvisor user
611579285.reviewBody: I went to Puerto Vallarta on vacation to visit a friend. He set up a day charter for us and some friends for the last day of my vacation. Justin, the captain, and Eddy were nothing less than incredible. The day had perfect weather until the afternoon it became a little stormy. Justin and Eddy made everyone feel safe and showed high level of sailing skills. Everyone made it back to the marina happy and safe! The boat is amazing and definitely a once in a lifetime experience! I would highly recommend sailing on this beautiful boat. Thank you Justin and Eddy for making my last day of vacation perfect!

593606707.name: Beautiful day
593606707.author: a TripAdvisor user
593606707.reviewBody: My family which includes my 84 year old dad and my 3 year old daughter, had a wonderful and relaxing day. The boat is a beauty, and the service and friendliness of the crew made it the icing on the cake. \nWe snorkeled, so some dolphins and sailed with some nice wind. Could not ask for a better day!! Thanks Justine!

592176563.name: Awesome Trip
592176563.author: a TripAdvisor user
592176563.reviewBody: Had an amazing time with Justin and his crew (Johnathan, Christian, and Augusto). Would recommend, 10/10.

582061985.name: Best Day Ever!!
582061985.author: a TripAdvisor user
582061985.reviewBody:
Our group of eight chartered the Ocean Light for a day on May 15th.  The weather was perfect, and we were looking forward to a trip that we didn't realize would be both awesome and unforgettable.  From when we first met Captain Justin and his crew to our departing at the end of the day it was just perfect.  Our trip started our of the marina as we motored towards Punta Mita.  Once near Punta Mita we dropped anchor and spent time swimming and paddle boarding alongside the boat.   We were fed lunch and all the beverages we could ask for - I don't thing I ever had an empty cup.  
Once everyone was back on board the crew came out with Champagne and an Anniversary cake for two of our couples and we had a celebration, toast, and dessert.
By then the wind had picked up - the crew hoisted sails and we were treated to a peaceful and relaxing trip back to the marina.  
As we entered the harbor, one of our group called the day "Best Day ever" and we all agreed.
Thank you Justin and crew for a fantastic day!!

578850299.name: An epic birthday
578850299.author: a TripAdvisor user
578850299.reviewBody: We were at La Cruz for my 60th and my wife booked us a day trip on the SV Ocean Light captianed by Justino and his intrepid crew. The craft is an old school wooden sailing ship lovenly restored by Justin and his crew. We motored up the coast to Punta de Minta, we started with a yummy fruit plate and then cervezas ( it\'s alway noon in Mexico) on the way we say dolphins and a couple of late season whales gave us a show.\nOnce anchored you can swim, paddle board, snorkel or just laze on deck. We then had a very nice lunch and then it\'s no more motor and it\'s full sail back to La Cruz ( 3 hrs.) the dolphins made another appearance and you get to see the coastal views the way you should, under sail with a cerveza in your hand.\nNow this tour can have up to eight people, but we were it and Justin didnt cancel like some might. So if your visiting PV go to La Cruz and sail with Bahia Sailing.

577732514.name: Amazing day on the water!
577732514.author: a TripAdvisor user
577732514.reviewBody: Bahia Sailing Tours is a great and super unique way to spend a day on the water! Justin and his crew were so friendly, knowledgeable, and fun, and made our day very special. And the boat, Ocean Light, is so beautiful! A trip we will remember for a long time!

571362779.name: Great adventure on the Ocean LIght
571362779.author: a TripAdvisor user
571362779.reviewBody: Our family went out on the Ocean Light for the day.   We had a great time.   We stopped and snorkeled, did some paddle boarding and swimming in a small bay.   From there we sailed across the bay looking for whales (didn\'t see any but it wasnt for lack of effort).  Did see dolphins and fish.  Justin and his crew were friendly and very accomodating.  I would highly recommend Bahai Sailing.  We will be going  again on our next trip to Puerto Vallarta

570497298.name: Great experience on Ocean Light
570497298.author: a TripAdvisor user
570497298.reviewBody: This was the perfect day for us as Justin and his crew were very flexible and provided an experience we will never forget.  We enjoyed a nice calm cruise to a secluded beach where we dropped anchor and enjoyed paddle boarding, jumping in the ocean and swimming to the beach.  From there we had a couple drinks and enjoyed the wonderful food which was prepared by the crew as we sailed to check out the whales.  For about 1 hour we were fortunate enough to observe 8->10 whales playing in the ocean as we took it easy and enjoyed the Ocean Light and all it had to offer.  Our day was capped off with a nice sail back to port.  Our kids haven\'t stopped talking about their experience that day and my father maintains it was the highlight of his trip to Nuevo Vallarta.  Thanks to Justin and his crew as we felt very privileged to be able to enjoy such a wonderful day on such a great boat with such great people.

569530776.name: A Fun Day with a Dynamite Crew!
569530776.author: a TripAdvisor user
569530776.reviewBody:
Our family chose the Yelapa Day Trip and had a great time on Friday, March 23, 2018. From booking online to returning to the marina, we all had a terrific experience. Aside from the amazing weather, we loved the sailing experience. Captain Justin greeted us at the marina gate and introduced us to Agusto and Cristian, once we climbed aboard. The Ocean Light Vancouver is a gorgeous, wooden sailboat kept clean and in pristine condition You can tell the entire crew takes pride in this vessel. We spent two hours sailing to Yelapa beach, having delicious fruit and beverages along the way. 

At Yelapa, two of us paddleboarded into the beach, while the other person took the local boat to shore. Yelapa is a unique spot we enjoyed discovering. The Ocean Light crew had lunch ready for us if we wanted to eat on the boat, so you have that option if you choose not to eat in Yelapa. You can have lunch on the boat and head to shore, or you can head to shore and eat there. After three hours of exploring, swimming and lounging, we headed to the boat and enjoyed the last couple of hours sailing back to La Cruz de Huanacaxtle. 

On our return journey, we saw dolphins, whales and a manta ray. Very cool! If you’re looking for a unique boat, a friendly crew and atmosphere and a great day on the water, Bahia Sailing is for you. We would highly recommend this Yelapa Day trip. Thanks so much, Justin, Agusto and Cristian, for your hospitality. You helped us create special memories in Mexico.

569382203.name: Perfecto!
569382203.author: a TripAdvisor user
569382203.reviewBody: Had an amazing time with Captain Justin, Augustino and Christian.  Absolutely beautiful wooden sail boat.  Saw several whales, dolphins lead the boat for a bit and just a great fun time.  Free beer, margaritas, water and ceviche.  One of the best days of my life!  Will definitely do this again!  Muchas gracias!

566155549.name: The perfect last day to our Holiday
566155549.author: a TripAdvisor user
566155549.reviewBody:
What to say, Captain Justin is awesome, the crew is awesome and wow what a boat the Ocean Light is, it was a treat to sail her on a sunny perfect day.

Captain Justin takes you to the destination but does not hesitate to detour with the sighting of a whale or other note worthy creature to see.

A powered voyage out and a sail back to the marina on a day which had all fall into place the way it should.

Thank you so much for the perfect day on the waters of Banderas Bay

Ben & Michelle

562374462.name: Whale watching
562374462.author: a TripAdvisor user
562374462.reviewBody: Great time had by all justino captain the  eat great crew great day , food , refreshment, great view of whales

561604541.name: Wet and wild
561604541.author: a TripAdvisor user
561604541.reviewBody: Captain Justin and his crew did everything within there power to give us an unbelievable experience. They pulled in fresh fish to make a meal that hit the spot. Constantly on the lookout they made sure we knew where the wales were and in what direction they would go to get some awesome shots. The drinks were mixed to perfection and were plentiful, wine and beer were in no short supply. The safety of all on board the Ocean Light was was always in the forefront of the Captain and his crews minds ensuring everyone had an enjoyable trip.\nI recommend Bahia sailing to everyone going to Puerto Vallarta best value hands down

560847955.name: An Amazing day in Bay of Banderas
560847955.author: a TripAdvisor user
560847955.reviewBody: Loved this sailing experience with Captain Justin and his mates Kristian and Augusto aboard "Ocean Light".  What a beautiful sailing vessel!  She is a beauty of boat that has been restored with love, dedication and a lot of hard work.  Truly this sail adventure was perfect and outstanding in every way - friendly, knowledgeable and skilled sailors who know how to deliver an incredible sail, tasty food and snacks, refreshing drinks, sights and music.  Within 5 minutes of leaving the marina we already knew we want to go again another day. Highest of recommendations to Justin and his crew.  Thanks again!

560548922.name: A day out on the water....
560548922.author: a TripAdvisor user
560548922.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time! We were with our family to celebrate a birthday. We had the oldest at 67 and the youngest at two and a half. The Captain and Crew attended to our every need. We had a delicious onboard lunch and tasty beverages! We even got to see humpback whales breaching in front of us! \nI would recommend Bahia Sailing Tours for your next excursion. Just tell them what you would like and they will do everything they can to make your day a reality!

560334700.name: BEST DAY EVER!
560334700.author: a TripAdvisor user
560334700.reviewBody: Justin and his crew are awesome! You definitely will have the greatest time ever. Food, beer, wine and mixed drinks were excellent. We can say enough great things about our experience. We recommending that you see for yourself. Absolutely worth every penny and then some!

558832520.name: The only way to go whale watching!
558832520.author: a TripAdvisor user
558832520.reviewBody: Justyn and his crew were terrific. Such a lovely sail in the Bay of Banderas.  The ceviche they served us was fabulous, the drinks were a nice touch and our three hour adventure was extended at no cost to us, because these guys just love their work.   It shows in how helpful and considerate they were for three senior ladies getting off, on and around their beautiful wooden sailboat.  We did see lots of whales, but the relaxing sail would have easily been worth the price.  See you next year Justyn!

558293750.name: True sailing experience
558293750.author: a TripAdvisor user
558293750.reviewBody: Our group of 10 wanted sails up and away! We opted to head towards Punta Mita and enjoy an afternoon sailing back through the bay. We saw more whales than we could count, dolphins along side of us, a sea turtle and manta ray. Justin and the crew took great care of us. We would/will do it again!

551364436.name: Another perfect sailing adventure!
551364436.author: a TripAdvisor user
551364436.reviewBody: My most recent trip to Yelapa with my family was simply amazing! But then again, so were my last two trips with Justin and his friendly, talented crew. Homemade snacks. Meals. Margaritas. Beer. Wine. Music. Dancing. Paddleboards. Sunshine. All served up to you on the most beautiful sail boat in the Marina. Every time is a brand new experience but always an incredible one. In the three times I have gone out with them, something new has happened each time. I\'ve seen whales, dolphins that swim alongside the boat, turtles, beautiful Yelapa, sunsets (and rises)... Truly the whole package. They fall short on nothing. A one of a kind boat for a one of a kind experience.

551352906.name: Day Sail to Yelapa
551352906.author: a TripAdvisor user
551352906.reviewBody: Justin and his crew are the true homies of the tourism industry. These guys make it feel like you\'re sailing with three extra friends instead of a crew while also being accommodating and helpful. 550987152.name: Unforgettable Sailing Experience!

550981444.name: Amazing sailing
550981444.author: a TripAdvisor user

549730362.name: Beautiful day on the water!

457132985.author: a TripAdvisor user
457132985.reviewBody:
Recently, I was on a family visit to Bahía de Banderas, close to beautiful Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, enjoying a perfect climate and most agreeable environment.

I received a surprise invitation to go sailing from Alex, a young but very experienced sailor who has navigated over several seas of the world. 

We sailed from the Marina in La Cruz, next to Punta de Mita, in a "Colgate" boat, with three other companions aboard. Alex put me at the helm and demonstrated his talent as a safe and patient instructor in a friendly and sportsmanlike manner.

The time flew by and the experience was enhanced by the appearance of whales who presented us with a beautiful and unique spectacle.

The day ended and we had to go back, but I was left with a mixture of emotions: pleasure, happy memories and appreciation, not having sailed for several years; I was very grateful for this unforgettable experience.

These guys are professional sailors and even if you have never sailed you will learn about sailing.  They are easy to work with and located right in the marina.  It was only my wife and I and one other fellow that had a little experience and was able to help the captain.  We saw some dolphins swimming along the boat and it was quite enjoyable being close to the water without a motor.  Great Experience

453649005.name: Beginners Sailing Course - excellent!
453649005.author: a TripAdvisor user
453649005.reviewBody:
I just completed an introductory 3-day sailing course with the International Sailing Academy in La Cruz de Haunacaxtle, Mexico (near Puerto Vallarta)...and it gets a solid 5 stars.

It is a very small school, but very professionally run...and it is in a fantastic location. They train newbies like me and also top racers from around the world. The Bay of Banderas is a sailors paradise. The wind picks up like clockwork every afternoon. Beautiful setting. If you ever thought about learning to sail, this is the place to learn. The sailboat that I used was a 26-footer...big enough to be a solid boat and yet easy enough to handle. It was just me and the instructor on the boat.

It is an "intensive" program...as it is sailing and more sailing. A combination of some basic theory so you understand some of the "why" of sailing (about 1 hour per day in the late morning) and then the hands-on "how" of actually sailing on the water (about 3-4 hours per day in the afternoon). 

I had zero sailing experience prior to these 3-days...and I (at 61 years of age) left feeling reasonably comfortable sailing a boat on the open-water by myself. Amazing...going from a newbie to a "sailor" in 3 days. It was an enjoyable 3 days, but it was not an easy 3 days. A lot to digest and apply, and you will (if like me, struggle at times). The sailing terminology takes some getting use to...for that we can blame the British :-). But trust me, if I can do it, you can do it. 

My instructor (Alex) was outstanding. A very good communicator; bilingual with excellent English. Very patient. Pushes you to learn and do more; and positive influence if/when you struggle. Alex loves teaching and it shows. Also extremely safety conscious. He has a tremendous amount of experience, and shares it in a clear manner. Thank you, Alex...you gave me the gift of sailing!

If you want to learn to sail...this is the place...the quality of school (ISA), the quality of the instructors (Alex!) AND the quality of the location can't be beat.

440235765.name: Came home a sailor
440235765.author: a TripAdvisor user
440235765.reviewBody:
What can I say about the 3-day intensive learn to sail from ISA. "Intensive" is correct, but the course structure paces the content perfectly. We didn't start in the classroom memorizing terminology (thank God! They would have lost me from the start); instead, ISA emailed an info packet after booking, and the course begins outside on the dock - feeling the wind and looking around the marina, already bringing to life the concepts from the info packet. I was lucky enough to be the only student for the week, and I was made to feel very comfortable by the experienced instructor, Alejandro/Alex. 

The pacing of the program was very good — each day progressed in such a manner that just as I was beginning to feel comfortable with the knowledge I had received, more content was added on to it. This makes the program "intensive", but it allowed me to push myself and keep a great pace of continued learning throughout the 3 days. By the end of it, I now feel 100% comfortable handling a sailboat out on the water, and I have a basic understanding of the science and technical aspects of sail power and how to control the sails to maximize speed or have a comfortable cruise. 

My background was that I had zero experience sailing before the program, and maybe I'd gone out with a sailor friend once or twice over the past ten years. Hopefully this inspires you to take the program if you're thinking about it. It was a big part of my vacation in Puerto Vallarta. The ISA staff were friendly and knowledgeable, even popping by some of the classroom sessions to lend some added insight. Great syllabus, drills, and teaching style. They need to promote the program better on the website, but I jumped at the opportunity and learned a new skill that I'll take with me forever. Muchas gracias to Alejandro, and the whole crew at ISA! See you for level II :)

364169364.name: Diving was great, scuba was not
364169364.author: a TripAdvisor user
364169364.reviewBody:
We had a mixed group for this excursion, snorkelers and scuba divers. Our dive was really good, we saw so many fish and had a lovely dive. The snorkeling was not as good. Now, I don't really blame Alex for this, but it has to be noted. 

We went to Los Arcos National Park, which is a beautiful spot. Unfortunately, it became overcrowded to the point of being dangerous. It was a very busy week because it was holy week (the same week as Easter), so there were almost 50 boats. Many of the boats didn't drop their anchors and instead used their engines to maneuver back and forth. There were fumes from all the engines. There were so many snorkelers, they were nearly on top of each other. It became dangerous to go from the boats to the snorkeling area because of all the boats with their engines on to keep their place. The snorkelers in our group had enough so we were unable to go on our second dive.

I guess I can't recommend a mixed group. The group stuck on the boat waiting for our dive to end was miserable and the two divers were unhappy losing out on our second dive that we paid for.

But, Alex was wonderful to work with leading up to the excursion. He was also great to dive with. I think under different circumstances, he would have been great for the snorkelers as well. There was a member of the snorkel group who was uneasy about snorkeling and because of the overcrowded conditions, she will not try snorkeling again. As I said, I don't blame Alex for this. The government should put limits put on how many can go to this site. 

Alex made us a lovely lunch. We had a wonderful salad with avocado and grilled chicken. He also had water, juice, fresh fruit and bread. 

The ride to Los Arcos was about 45 minutes and beautiful. I think at a less busy time of year, this would be an ideal spot. 

I would love to give Blue Tortuga another try, but I would not go with a mixed group again, unless we went to an island or a beach where the snorkelers could get off the boat. It was a pleasure working with Alex and we really appreciated how he ran the dive portion.

363868255.name: Alex and his crew made this day at Islas Marietas the highlight of the trip!
363868255.author: a TripAdvisor user
363868255.reviewBody:
We booked thru Blue Tortuga based on the extensive website and Alex's patience with my many emailed questions.  I knew I didn't want a large tourist booze cruise for 8 hours.  My sister and her husband wanted to know that the trip would be fairly calm and the boat would have a bathroom and room to hang out if someone didn't want to snorkel.  Alex listened to all my "family issues" :) and tailored an excursion just for us.  IT WAS AWESOME.  He encouraged us to leave early and in hindsight he was the expert on that for sure.  The waters were calm, we had no trouble getting into the Love Beach at that tide and hour.  He showed us some amazing caves and even got my claustrophobic sister to go thru a super cool water cave with only 18" above her head!  I chickened out but there's always next time.  
Alex had a crew of four for us so there was always someone to help with equipment or directions.  The lovely and accomplished Gabi was especially nurturing to my sister and husband who are 67 and 70.  They were really grateful afterwards and said they never would have gotten that level of attention with another outfit.  
Snacks were amazing fresh fruit, crisps and biscuits (Australian for chips and cookies) and some lovely sandwiches.  
Alex the Australian dive master, seaman, casual biologist was really enthusiastic to share his knowledge of the areas terrain, history and animals with us.  He pointed out fish during the snorkeling and later on the boat pulled out the cards so we could see them again and remember the names.  We saw a black puffer fish among other beautiful fish.
All in all we felt like we had met some local friends and they took us out on the boat for the day...

360518842.name: The highlight of our holiday in Puerto Vallarta - really great experience
360518842.author: a TripAdvisor user
360518842.reviewBody:
My wife and I did a day trip with Blue Tortuga Adventures. We started the day planning to do a scuba dive but ended up doing a tour of the Puerto Vallarta mangroves, scuba diving and snorkelling at Los Arcos, and some whale watching in the bay on the way home (it was a action packed day!). The other dive / tour boats that we saw were large commercial boats packed with loads of tourists. What made our tour so special was that Alex's boat was private (it was just my wife and I) and as such the tour was much more personalised and flexible.

We found Alex (Owner/Operator/dive instructor) to be very friendly, knowledgeable and professional. This was my first dive in quiet some time and I was a little nervous. Alex is a great instructor and made me feel comfortable. 

In short, we had a great experience with Blue Tortuga Adventures and couldn't recommend Alex and the team enough.

357826197.name: Excellent Adventures
357826197.author: a TripAdvisor user
357826197.reviewBody: Myself and my boyfriend took two seperate tours with this company while we were in Mexico for two weeks. The first tour was to Marietas island and our gracious tour guide took us out early so we were able to enjoy the hidden beach privately before the masses of other tour groups arrived. He packed yummy snacks and home brewed tea as well as taking photos that were great quality which were emailed to me after. The second tour we took was a combo tour of the Maldives and a snorkel spot (can\'t remember the name) same great experience, we even saw whales and sea turtles! If we return we will definitely take a few tours with this awesome dude! Highly recommend!

357433832.name: Los arcos diving and marietas trip
357433832.author: a TripAdvisor user
357433832.reviewBody: Alex customized a perfect diving trip for my family and I, taking special care for safety while keeping it low stress and fun. He packed a custom lunch and snacks, and provided for a varied groups wants and needs. We are scheduling for a trip to the marietas with him tomorrow. Highly recommend.

356198753.name: Snorkle and mangrove tour
356198753.author: a TripAdvisor user
356198753.reviewBody: Enjoyed our time with family. Learned many things about the mangrove channels. Enjoyed the wildlife. Los Archos Natl park was beautiful. Alex was very accommodating with our grandson(10 mths) and our lunch was very healthy.

356194757.name: Blue Tortuga Adventures
356194757.author: a TripAdvisor user
356194757.reviewBody: Really good experience!! My family and me enjoyed  and learn about the ocean with excelent atention of our guide!! We saw whales, manglares, birds, delfines etc.!! Unforgetable!!

356187121.name: Had a great time!
356187121.author: a TripAdvisor user
356187121.reviewBody: We had 4 grown ups and our 10 month old out on the boat! It was such a great time seeing all the iguanas in the mangroves and all the sea turtles. They were everywhere. Alex also brought us some natural beverages and food to eat which really tasted great after snorkeling around the Los argos national park!

355932021.name: Master divers course
355932021.author: a TripAdvisor user
355932021.reviewBody: Alex was my master divers instructor while on holiday in Puerto Vallarta, I\'ve dived a lot of places with a lot of divers/instructors so can honestly say Alex is not only a seriously good instructor, he\'s also a great bloke, totally professional when it matters, great laugh, interesting and all round good egg the rest of the time, Alex was working through Twin Dolphins when I was there but I have no doubt his own tour/adventure company will be as much fun, interesting and best bang for your buck- do yourself a favour and book an adventure with Blue Tortuga today

355925230.name: Amazing personalised dives and surf trip
355925230.author: a TripAdvisor user
355925230.reviewBody: Alex looked after my wife and I on several occasions on our journey through Mexico. We dived the bay twice (just the three of us) then tried skurfing behind the boat on the trip back. Alex was amazingly accommodating to our needs and had a high-5 for every occasion!\nAlex invited me to explore the points north of Vallarta and we found a couple of great right points which were firing the whole trip. Alex has a larger than life personality, and will ensure you have a great time while diving and surfing Mexico!

355890044.name: Pure excellence
355890044.author: a TripAdvisor user
355890044.reviewBody:
I did a boat tour with Alex, the owner of Blue Tortuga and some other guests. It was like a day with good friends even we all didnt know each other. We have been chatting with along the way, he shared lot of info’s about the local biodiversity and brought us some nice snacks.

We have been to the Mangroves, to some huge rock formations with big swim throughs in it and further along the coast.   

We have seen many many, iguanas, various birds and fishes. On the way back he spotted several Turtles and luckily view Dolphins. 

Alex is a laid back guy and very professional. Both thumbs up. 

Recommend it to any person who is looking for a good time in the nature.

343846519.name: Fun and Wonder on the water that Exceeded expectations
343846519.author: a TripAdvisor user
343846519.reviewBody: Our group of 3 got a custom combo tour that was aMazing! A smaller boat meant we were comfortable and got us the best vantage point for whale spotting which blew us away!\nOur guide was a native English speaker who clearly loved his work and knew so much.  The mangrove canals were so alive!  We got to Los Arcos for a snorkel (you can dive too). Alex was the best guide. We all felt so safe and involved. No more big boat type tours for us!  We were able to add on a extra bit to go to a beautiful secluded beach. Great trip - no faults - awesome value. Will be back - for sure!

668803890.name: Perfect service and great experience
668803890.author: a TripAdvisor user
668803890.reviewBody: We visited the Marieta Islands with Chuck\'s Tours and it was wonderfull! Everyone was very friendly and fun, the boat trip was a great experience (with dolphins and even a whale!) and we arrived at the hidden beach before everyone else. It was a magical visit! We spotted a lot of birds and the guide told us interesting anekdotes. We are very glad to have done this activity with Chuck (rather then going there on a crowded "party boat) ! Thanks, it\'s something we will remember forever !

itemReviewed.name: Chuck's Tours, La Cruz and Bucerias

663304144.name: Chuck\u2019s does it all!
663304144.author: a TripAdvisor user
663304144.reviewBody: From airport pickup and translation to fishing to touring etc, Chucks Tours is the only way to go in the La Cruz and Bucerias area.  Chuck and staff know it all and are very personable and reasonably priced.  They took the hassle and confusion out of our excursions. We highly recommend their operation on several fronts.

itemReviewed.name: Chuck's Tours, La Cruz and Bucerias

658673556.name: Great Experience With Chucks Tours
658673556.author: a TripAdvisor user
658673556.reviewBody: Some friends told us Chuck won the best tour guide in the area for 2019 and I can see why. He is extremely personable and ensures you\'re always having a good time. Also, he connected us with all the best local places to eat. \n\nWe went on a whale watching tour with Chuck and it was an absolute blast. I highly recommend Chuck\'s Tours if you plan on adventuring while you\'re in La Cruz!

itemReviewed.name: Chuck's Tours, La Cruz and Bucerias

591554673.name: Fishing trip to la Corbetena
591554673.author: a TripAdvisor user
591554673.reviewBody: Danny is an amazing captain and is extremely knowledgeable in his line of work. Seas were rough in the morning on the way out to la corbetenia, but we roughed it out with my 9 year old son aboard, and I\u2019m glad that we did!! The trip was one to remember. We hooked a nice sailfish on the way to the grounds and once we got there it was epic!! Hooked up on  15 yellow fin tuna ranging from 10-60 lbs, also caught 3 jack cravelle (they fight good). The deck hand ( Danny\u2019s long time friend) was also amazing. \n      I have been on Multiple fishing trips in Kona, Cabo San Lucas and San Diego, and I have to say that this was the best one. The boat and crew are well equipped. I can\u2019t wait to fish with these guys again we got lucky finding them. We will back Danny I want to land a cow tuna!!

505868730.name: Super nice guy - friendly and easy going
505868730.author: a TripAdvisor user
505868730.reviewBody: Danny has captained our boat on numerous occasions. He\'s great company, trustworthy and takes his job seriously.  Depending on the time of year, it may be best to go out for a full day or even overnight for yellow fin tuna.

450224653.name: Fishing with Danny and Edgar
450224653.author: a TripAdvisor user
450224653.reviewBody: Went fishing December 29, 2016 with Danny and Edgar. It was me and my three adult kids. Had a great time, hooked and landed in total 5 jack crevalle, 1 sierra and possibly a bull shark (not landed). Danny is an excellent guide who made sure we all had some action and that everyone had fun. Thanks Danny. Would highly recommend booking with Danny.\n\n

433781376.name: Great fishing!
433781376.author: a TripAdvisor user
433781376.reviewBody: Danny is one of the best captains I have fished with, he is serious about putting you on the fish. His boat is simple but outfitted with everything you need for a days fishing.\nDepending on the season we have caught tuna, dorado, snapper (pargo) and billfish, Danny takes great care of the fish after the catch as well, making for excellent tablefare.

342830692.name: Wahoo!
342830692.author: a TripAdvisor user
342830692.reviewBody: If you are in the Puerto Vallarta area and want the best chance at some game fish, danny is your guy. Great boat, great deckhand, and great knowledge of local waters.  We had a blast!

339797007.name: LOADED THE BOAT!
339797007.author: a TripAdvisor user
339797007.reviewBody: Went out with Danny and once again we had a great day. His son Danny Jr. was on board as the first mate and he did a great job. We caught a few dorados, a couple of tunas and a sailfish which we released. \n If you are a serious about catching fish this is the boat for you because Danny is relentless in his pursuit and always brings home the fish! \nKent

331536233.name: Simply the best
331536233.author: a TripAdvisor user
331536233.reviewBody: I have fished with Danny for the last six years. Every single trip is OUTSTANDING. He is 100% focused on catching fish. Period. Speaks perfect English, and is very informative about what he\'s doing, and why. This is a fishing trip for serious fishermen/women.

189701553.name: FISHING AT ITS BEST
189701553.author: a TripAdvisor user
189701553.reviewBody: I have been fishing with Capitan Danny Gomez  numerous times since moving to this area and we always come back with the big fish. \nDanny and first mate Hector are very serious when it comes to fishing and very good at what they do. Danny also speaks perfect English which makes the trip even better. Now understand they go after the big game fish so if you are looking to take a casual ride and drop a line for a snapper or two while you watch the whales frolic, well take my advice and pick another boat. Last time me and a friend went out with them we caught 2 or 3 Dorados, I landed a trophy Sailfish which I smoked and two really nice Yellow Fin Tunas. The boat is equipped with the finest equipment available and after 18 years of fishing in these waters Danny has a sixth sense for finding the fish. On top of of that he is a trip to watch while he is in the hunt, I was amassed the first time as I had been out on other fishing boats in this area. The three other boats I went on were totally different, the Capitans drove around nonchalantly hoping a fish might bite, not the case on the DHARMAR, these guys are obsessed with finding the fish and maybe that is why the always do.

665309007.name: Wow!
665309007.author: a TripAdvisor user
665309007.reviewBody: We had a great time sailing and whale watching with Red Dolphin. The drinks, service, boat and lunch were all top notch. We managed to see whales even though the season had ended. This was a highlight of our stay in Mexico, many thanks to Johnny and Michelle!

664857154.name: Relaxing day with Red Dolphin
664857154.author: a TripAdvisor user
664857154.reviewBody: Highly recommend these guys.  Very nice boat and super professional crew.  Michele was awesome...she made the best lunch!\n\nMike was very quick to respond to all email inquiries and questions.  If you are looking for a nice laid back excursion with professional crew you can\'t go wrong with Red Dolphin!

663976474.name: Whale-watching adventure
663976474.author: a TripAdvisor user
663976474.reviewBody: There were three couples out for a cruise with Johnny and Michele on the beautiful sailboat, Indian Summer. Out for about three and a half hours, we cruised around looking at the humpback whales in Banderas Bay. One mother and baby came by the check us out...we were drifting. The mother lay on her back just below the surface while the baby whale bobbed along on the surface over her belly. Magical! Good drinks, good snacks, good conversation. All together a very good day! \n\n

663303688.name: 3rd time still the charm
663303688.author: a TripAdvisor user
663303688.reviewBody: Back again for a great sailing day.  3rd visit with the great crew of Johnny and Michelle, missed Mike but still had a wonderful day. Knowledgeable and safety oriented crew. Great food and drinks. Absolutely can\u2019t go wrong with any of their trips!!! Top notch!!

652855755.name: Always the best whale watching adventure!
652855755.author: a TripAdvisor user
652855755.reviewBody: Whenever we have friends in town that want to see whales, our go to excursion is Red Dolphin! We\'ve been on Indian Summer before and she\'s an excellent cruising sailboat.  A 45\' keel boat with all of the amenities for a great day on the water. The crew will deliver to you, your favorite frosty adult beverage. Freshly made guacamole and chips to snack on while watching humpback whales and dolphins. Then there\'s the freshly cooked, on board, lunch. This is not a jam pack booze cruise, aka: whale watching with a hundred of your favorite drinking buddies. Nope. It\'s limited to about 10 patrons and you will receive individual attention from the crew. Whether it\'s Capt. Mike or Capt. Jonny, and crew, you will receive first class  treatment. Our friends always remark about how great the experience was. I will continue to cruise/whale watch with Red Dolphin. Thanks Mike, Jonny, Michelle and crew for your great work in ensuring a quality cruise. We will be back! Adios amigos!

652573690.name: The Go-To Sailing Charter For Whale Watching In La Cruz
652573690.author: a TripAdvisor user
652573690.reviewBody: My wife and I have the good fortune to have retired and live in the town of La Cruz. Friends visit us during High Season and always wish to go Whale Watching. We have sailed with Red Dolphin Charters on numerous occasions because they are the best choice for Whale Watch and Sunset excursions. The laid-back atmosphere Michael, Michelle and Johnny offer makes for a wonderful experience. They provide all drinks, alcoholic and non-alcoholic, snacks and a delicious lunch of Chicken Burritos, prepared below in the boat\'s galley. We have yet to be disappointed with our sailing trips on Red Dolphin\'s 45 footer, "Indian Summer". If you wish to see whales, beautiful sunsets or just spend some time on the ocean, Red Dolphin Charters is the service to use when you are visiting the La Cruz area.

648589225.name: Awesome day on the bay:  "Captain there be whales, everywhere"
648589225.author: a TripAdvisor user
648589225.reviewBody: The crew is first rate!  Within about 20 mins we were in the middle of the bay following whales.  Captain did an awesome job placing us in the right spots to watch 4 whales and numerous dolphins at play.  They also kept the beverages flowing so we remained "hydrated".  As the whale activities slowed, we move to our next stop...a secluded beach.  On the way there the Captain spotted a "fever" of manta rays.  We stopped and watched the added treat!  Michelle crafted wonderful burritos while underway.  We also had time to take a brief dip in the bay.  The crew excelled in getting folks safely in and out of the water.  They went above and beyond in assisting a lady into and out of the water.  She was very nervous, but they made her comfortable and she was all smiles when back on the boat.  A cruise on the Indian Summer was the perfect start to our adventures.

648233801.name: Another Outstanding Sail!
648233801.author: a TripAdvisor user
648233801.reviewBody: Mike, Jonny and Joey hosted us on the Indian Summer for an evening of sailing that included multiple dolphin, whale and sea turtle sightings, along with a delicious dinner and a beautiful sunset.  We sailed with Captain Mike two years ago for my mom\'s birthday, and had a fabulous evening.  I wasn\'t sure we could top it, or even match it, but tonight, as we celebrated my dad\'s birthday, we saw more whales than on our previous outing, and had an equally fabulous night!  We missed Michelle, but Mike prepared a delicious meal in her absence. Jonny and Joey mixed delicious cocktails and made fantastic guacamole, too. Our family highly recommends sailing with Mike and his crew.  You will not be disappointed!

647591826.name: Whale watching
647591826.author: a TripAdvisor user
647591826.reviewBody: Excellent service with Michelle, Johnny and their new co worker Yucan?? Not certain how to spell his name . Wonderful burritos .

643178679.name: Second Review
643178679.author: a TripAdvisor user
643178679.reviewBody: This was the second time that we used Red Dolphin Cruises for a whale watching trip.  Just like the first time, the crew is efficient and attentive, the sailboat is clean and comfortable and the trip was exactly as expected.  I fully expect to book them for next years whale watching trip

641679604.name: High bar on our group and they surpassed it!
641679604.author: a TripAdvisor user
641679604.reviewBody: From start to finish, our group of seven loved every minute. Quick trip from Four Seasons Punta de Mita. Great crew, comfortable seating, beautiful day on the water... Even the Humpback whales wanted to hang with us! Incredible to watch 6 of them pass by as we filmed on our cameras. Yelapa was a really fun beach hangout and interesting destination to hike into the village. Young adults and parents all had a blast.

640585795.name: Amazing experience
640585795.author: a TripAdvisor user
640585795.reviewBody: We went on the whale watching tour today with Michelle, Jonny and Joey and had the most wonderful time. \nThe boat was immaculate, the staff was amazing and the food was delicious. The entire experience with the crew was perfect. As we were following the whales around the bay today we stayed as a respectable distance and never charged full speed ahead as other boats did towards the whales. They showed respect for the rules and the ocean which I truly appreciated. We will be back for another sail next year.

640498889.name: Don\'t hesitate - book it
640498889.author: a TripAdvisor user
640498889.reviewBody: We went on a sunset cruise with Mike, Michelle, Jonny and Joey on the second week of December.  The boat and crew are simply the best you could wish for, and nothing was too much trouble for them in making sure you had everything you needed during the trip. Our glasses of beer and margaritas were never empty and the food was delicious.  Mike and Michelle kept us entertained with information and stories about their previous sailing experiences and the local area and the bay.  The sea was very calm and the cloud did cut out the final bit of the sunset, but we had a wonderful time. Highly recommended.

639809010.name: What an awesome host for a day on the water!
639809010.author: a TripAdvisor user
639809010.reviewBody: Captain Mike! What can we say? We booked his services for 13 of us for a full day - and off we went to Yelapa. It was a leisurely, beautiful ride with cold (very excellent) margaritas and cans of beer always available. There was music, watching for dolphins and whales, and lots of great stories. Mike and his crew were SO fantastic - when one of our friends got seasick they gave her a hand. We had killer burritos as a snack on the way out, and after visiting Yelapa we were served really fantastic meals out of the kitchen - including fish (and chicken for me) that had been prepared in a sous vide - you don\'t find that nice a touch on many tours! We also had some time to swim and take photos - and so much time to just enjoy the fresh air, the scenery, and relax. Sailing with Captain Mike and his crew for a day is like sailing with an old friend. I would recommend Mike and his crew to ANY group of family or friends for an excursion - I think his prices are incredibly reasonable and a really great value. SO friendly, so welcoming. What a gem.

639373512.name: Second Sailing Trip with Red Dolphin
639373512.author: a TripAdvisor user
639373512.reviewBody: This was our second sailing trip with Mike\u2019s crew. Johnny, Michelle and Jaber treated us to a great four hour tour. We saw whales and dolphins.  We swam and paddle boarded in the bay. Ate amazing chicken burritos and drank lots of drinks. \nEleven of us sailed and everyone enjoyed the adventure. We will book again.

635448647.name: Incredible Dive Masters for a Great Dive
635448647.author: a TripAdvisor user
635448647.reviewBody: The entire team is amazing! Very helpful in explaining procedure and ensuring you will have a safe and enjoyable dive. We saw a HUGE 20\' Manta Ray and the dive team took a fishing hook out of him which led to it playing with us for 30 minutes. One of the best dives of my life! Highly recommended.

635444558.name: Fun Family day on the Ocean
635444558.author: a TripAdvisor user
635444558.reviewBody: My husband and I and our 6 adult children had an absolutely fabulous day on the boat.  Mike, Captain Johnny and Rafael were amazing hosts.  We boated, swam, snorkeled.  Michelle made a great lunch, Rafael made the best margaritas in the bay.  Thanks for helping us make wonderful memories!

571337280.name: The Marina
571337280.author: a TripAdvisor user
571337280.reviewBody: This is a fabulous Marina.  So many different beautiful big and small water crafts.  The full moon shining on the Marina water looks like glass.  The view, the people, the serenity and the peacefulness in this area is breath taking!

571057855.name: the most amazing day
571057855.author: a TripAdvisor user
571057855.reviewBody: My family and I spent the day with Captain Mike, Johnny and Rafael.  It was the end of the season but with much effort Johnny found us the whales!!  The kids were so amazed and after spending 13 days in the area this day was unanimously our FAVOURITE day!  The food was excellent and the Margaritas were the BEST!  I highly recommend this tour to everyone!

567868970.name: Third Trip With Red Dolphin Sailing Charters
567868970.author: a TripAdvisor user
567868970.reviewBody: For the third time this season, we booked sail with Red Dolphin Cruises for their Whale Watching trip. For the third time this season, the cruise was really special. Captain Mike, Michelle and Johnny are truly fantastic. They know exactly where to sail in order to see the Humpbacks. We had six people in our group, along with a group of four. They provided drinks, cocktails, chips and guacamole and some delicious burritos for us. We sailed for 4 hours, leaving at 10 AM and returning at 2 PM. The day was perfect. This is definitely the charter to use in the area. You will not be disappointed. Give them a try. You will be telling your friends about them, afterwards.

567475254.name: Relaxing and sailing with whales and dolphins!
567475254.author: a TripAdvisor user
567475254.reviewBody: One of my favorite things to do when traveling to the Bah\u00eda de Banderas is to get out on the water and and see the whales up close and personal.  We saw several whales with their calves and came across a small pod of dolphins that swam with the bow of our boat.  Thank you to Mike and his team for taking very good care of us and making sure we enjoyed our time.  Can\'t wait to return!

563408497.name: Highly recommend
563408497.author: a TripAdvisor user
563408497.reviewBody: Just got back from 12 glorious days in Bucerias MX, 1 of which was spent with Captain Mike, Michelle and Johnny on the Indian Summer. The day was perfect. We had a group of 6 and enjoyed a day sail to Yelapa that included whale watching, really great company with a fabulous lunch and the best margaritta\'s. I will definitely add to our itinerary for next year.

561392441.name: great value for money in La Cruz!
561392441.author: a TripAdvisor user
561392441.reviewBody: I took two trips with Captain Mike in January/February this year, and both were fantastic. One was for whale watching. Mike had told us there were lots of whales this year, and we must have seen most of them, at times there were whales on both sides of the boat. We saw lots of tails and spouts, some quite close, several breaches, and one whale spy hopping at a nearby boat as if it was people watching! Great trip.\nThe other was a trip to Yelapa, which was also very enjoyable. I always enjoy being out on the water, and the cruise across the bay was lovely, we had a couple of hours to explore Yelapa, ending up for drinks on the beach till it was time to return. Michelle and Johnny provided a light lunch of chicken burritos, delicious, and then on the return trip we were served another meal of fresh cooked local fish, plus all the drinks you wanted. \nTwo wonderful days - thanks to Captain Mike, Michelle and Johnny.

561329266.name: Highlight of holiday!
561329266.author: a TripAdvisor user
561329266.reviewBody:
Loved our whale watching experience so much we did it twice!

Mike, Michelle and Johhny were the most welcoming and gracious hosts possible and the whales, mantas and Dolphins were incredible as was the mid Banderas bay swim.

Can't say enough good things.

Genelle and Paul - Kelowna

559886853.name: Whale watching
559886853.author: a TripAdvisor user
559886853.reviewBody: We just had the best experience ever today, saw whales, dolphins, sea turtle, and more whales! It was an absolutely beautiful day, Captain Mike and his crew are awesome, drinks and food were great, only 14 passengers in total, great companions, could not have asked for more. Highly recommend.

559223288.name: Amazing Sunset Tour
559223288.author: a TripAdvisor user
559223288.reviewBody: Captain Mike his crew of Michelle and Johnny made the cruise simple wonderful! They took us to the areas in the Bay so we were able to see the Humbacks in action! Red Dolphins crew was totally attentive to us throughout the cruise and made it memorable! Coolest part was when they put a hydrophone into the water so we could hear the whales sounding! Simple amazing and highly recommended to anyone visiting the area!

557624522.name: Whale Watching
557624522.author: a TripAdvisor user
557624522.reviewBody:
Why a great day.  Mike, Michelle, and Johnny treated us to a wonderful half day cruise to see whales out on Banderas Bay.

The whales were jumping and splashing and very numerous - quite an experience.  It was also so much better to be part of a small group on a sailboat rather that one of the big, one the top catamaran cruises!!

We’ll definitely sign up again when we’re ready to go back out!!

Thanks

557188118.name: Am amazing day
557188118.author: a TripAdvisor user
557188118.reviewBody: Like others have written, we also thoroughly enjoyed our sail around Banderas Bay with Captain Mike and his amazing crew.  We saw dozens of whales on our tour, and some quite close!Mike takes great care to avoid the large clusters of boats that congregate around the whales.  Captain Mike also has an underwater microphone to listen in to the whales as they are nearby.  On top of the whale sightings, we also enjoyed delicious margaritas, and homemade burritos for lunch. Top off the afternoon with a nice swim, and it all adds up to an amazing tour for our group of 10 friends, and we will do it again next time in La Cruz. Thanks Captain Mike!!

555628772.name: Whales galore
555628772.author: a TripAdvisor user
555628772.reviewBody: We just returned from another great sailing day with Mike and Michelle. It is always a pleasure to travel with them. They are very professional but the whole day is just so relaxing especially after one of their special margaritas. Mike always plays the best music and Michelle will even practice speaking Spanish with you if you are so inclined.\nWe saw so many whales it was difficult to keep track of how many. The sail included a stop for swimming, kayaking, snorkelling and paddle boarding. This is a great way to spend a day and to experience the views of La Cruz from the water.

554772508.name: whale watching
554772508.author: a TripAdvisor user
554772508.reviewBody: The best trip ever. Mike is so informative, michelle and johnny wonderful. Take a trip. Great that they  only take a few people. 7 plus crew for our trip.  Started to see whales so quickly. Very close. Wow\nTried tp post pictures and video but kept kicking me out.

554560103.name: Amazing sun set sail
554560103.author: a TripAdvisor user
554560103.reviewBody: Thanks Mike and staff for the great sunset sail . Mike and staff Amazing. Well worth the money\nService, food, safety, all perfect!

553837156.name: Sailing to Yelapa Bay
553837156.author: a TripAdvisor user
553837156.reviewBody: We sailed to Yelapa Bay on Indian Summer with Captain Mike, Michelle and Johnny.  The boat provided plenty of room for 8 of us to venture out on our 8 hour tour.  On our way to Yelapa we saw many whales and dolphins and were able to listen to them, what an experience.  Michelle served the best margaritas.  She is a wonderful chef and we ate yummy burritos.  Once in Yelapa Bay, we took a panga to the dock.  We then explored this little village and walked to a waterfall.  Johnny and Mike were our tour guides.  We made our way through town to the beach where we had a few drinks. Be prepared to get drinks and/or food on the beach before heading back to the boat.  Also, take cash for the panga boat. \n Once back on the boat, Michelle had whipped up mahi mahi and rice for lunch.  We ate lunch and drank more drinks on our sail back to La Cruz.\nWe will do it again on our next trip to the area.

553642728.name: Amazing whale watching trip!
553642728.author: a TripAdvisor user
553642728.reviewBody: OMG, today we went on a whale watching cruise with Captain Mike & crew on "Indian Summer" & it was AMAZING!!!  We have been in the Bay area for 10 years & went on various different whale watching cruises...this is truly the best trip we have ever been on!  We saw lots of whales, both mature adults & calves, as well as huge manta rays in the water.  The cruise took place on a spectular, 45ft Hunter Passage Maker.  Truly awesome boat and as exerpienced boaters, we were very impressed with the level of safety features, as well as the PRISTINE condition of the boat.  Captain Mike was awesome, very engaging & happy to answer any & all questions.  His First Mate, Michelle, was boat smart and provided delicious food & drink.  Johnny, the other crew member, was knowledgeable about the boat and sealife and acted as co-captain and marine life spoter.  It was a truly awesome day and we cannot recommend Captain Mike and his crew highly enough!!  Thank you all for a spectular experience!!!\nSincerely,\nJoe & Priscilla Sulham

552968787.name: Pleasant Whale Watching Experience
552968787.author: a TripAdvisor user
552968787.reviewBody: I would highly recommend joining Mike and his crew for a few hours on the Bay Of Banderas, I was fortunate to go twice in my two week stay, the first time was with my parents who are in their early 80\'s and don\'t like loud booze cruise type trips and require shade, we shared the trip with another multi generational family. The 4 hours was the perfect amount of time. Listening to the whales was a highlight on both trips. The second trip was with some family friends and my teen age daughter, everyone loved it and the swim time was fun too.The Boat is super comfortable for shade seekers and sun worshipers. Mike takes care in not joining the onslaught of other boats around the Whales and is gret at answering multiple questions from all ages

552030951.name: Always an Amazing Experience
552030951.author: a TripAdvisor user
552030951.reviewBody:
We have been out with Capt Mike several times over the last few years and I apologize as I neglected to write reviews!

We have been out whale watching, day cruising and also for Sunset Cruises ... the crew is friendly, professional and have always been very attentive to our every needs!  They love their job and it shows!  Michelle's cooking is just amazing and when you realize what she accomplishes in the galley ... you have to see it for yourself.  The best margaritas I have ever had on the water!
Mike has an hydrophone and  you can listen to whales and dolphins as they travel around the boat etc ... A truly excellent experience!
We will be back again and again ... as I could not see myself going out on the bay with anyone else!!!

550724316.name: Great Day on the Bay
550724316.author: a TripAdvisor user
550724316.reviewBody:
We have been in the Bucerias area for the last five years, have used various tour companies/operators/providers, etc., for various water excursions and, while for the most part, we haven't had many problems/issues, there always some trepidation when  you book, hire or go thru a tour operator (as to wheather you will actually receive good value for your fee?). 
I am happy to report that this charter company is truly a gem to deal with, mainly because you actually deal with the person that owns/drives the boat for your excursion, not a go-between company. I had booked a full day for 13 people, however on our scheduled date several in our party were unable to participate due to stomach issues, after discussing with Mike he most graciously offered to postpone for a couple of days so everyone had a chance to recover.
Two days later we were off on the bay, had a fabulous time, excellent crew, delicious snacks/lunch in a comfortable sailboat setting.
I highly recommend this charter company and will definitely use him again.  You will not be disappointed.

549359534.name: Outstanding Cruise
549359534.author: a TripAdvisor user
549359534.reviewBody: Mike and his crew were absolutely outstanding.  We had 9 people, 4 adults and 5 kids from 9-16 in ages.  He\u2019s a tremendous guy, great captain and we can\u2019t recommend this 4 hour excursion highly enough.  Thanks for the great time Captain Mike!

546911473.name: Amazing Day On The Bay!
546911473.author: a TripAdvisor user
546911473.reviewBody:
An amazing whale watching experience from start to finish! 

Banderas Bay is the 7th largest bay in the world and few know it better than Captain Mike. Within an hour of leaving the La Cruz marina we were at the site of an incredible pod of 20 plus whales. Mike was very respectful of their space and set us up for a once in a lifetime display.  His boat Indian Summer is perfect for a small to mid sized group which allowed for a very personal experience. The tunes were awesome, the service was exceptional. 

Top notch all the way!!!

546612411.name: A Wonderful Sailing trip Aboard the Indian Summer
546612411.author: a TripAdvisor user
546612411.reviewBody: On a beautiful Sunday morning, four of us went sailing with Captain Mike Boss, aboard his 45 footer, Indian Summer. We sailed from the marina at La Cruz De Huanacaxtle. The day was everything we hoped for and more. Mike knew where to sail in order for us to see whales breaching and dolphins, that swam along side our boat. Johnny, the co-captain, provided refreshments and also served us a delicious lunch, while on board. The day was perfect. Captains Mike and Johnny showed us a wonderful time. I would wholeheartedly recommend a sailing trip with Red Dolphin Charters. They offer many options to choose from. Go sailing!

477560026.name: Out and About with Red Dolphin Sailing Charters
477560026.author: a TripAdvisor user
477560026.reviewBody:
We had the most delightful day of sailing with Red Dolphin Sailing Charters in early April. Captain Mike was very pleasant and professional to work with in setting up the booking and planning the itinerary. He was prompt in his responses and very open to accommodate and customize the day for us. In the end, we settled on a sail to Yelapa as half of us had not visited there before.

Indian Summer is a lovely sailing yacht - clean, well maintained and very comfortable.  It can accommodate up to 14 but we were happy to be a group of 8 as there was plenty of room for everyone to be comfortable in the shade of the bimini or to stretch out on the bow in the sun. Captain Mike provided a great selection of beverages and we brought our own wine. Michelle served up guacamole followed and a small but  delicious chicken burrito as a snacks on the sail (motor actually) across to Yelapa. Partway on the sail to Yelapa Mike had a confession...our shoes had been accidentally left behind on the dock in La Cruz! No one was overly fussed but Michelle took all of our shoe sizes and by the time we landed in Yelapa we were fitted out with new sandals courtesy of Red Dolphin Sailing Charters.

Juan toured us around the village and up to the falls (not much to see there during the dry season) and then we spent a little time on the beach enjoying the sun, water and  cervazas before returning to Indian Summer for a yummy fish lunch with Mikes secret sauce!  As promised and on cue the wind came up as we left Yelapa and we had the most fantastic sail all the way across to La Cruz!! The seasoned sailors among us were duly impressed - Captain Mike knew exactly how to take maximum advantage of the wind and still have a comfortable sail. It was exhilarating.

I recommend a sail with Red Dolphin Sailing Charters - it's a first class, authentic sailing experience with truly genuine people that are a pleasure to spend a day with. We'll book again for sure.  One last thing -  Captain Mike is quite a musicphile and plays great tunes on board!

473949403.name: AMAZING DAY
473949403.author: a TripAdvisor user
473949403.reviewBody: 11 of us took the day cruise to Yelapa. Mike and his crew were amazing. The food , drinks, and service were 5 star! Once in Yelapa, Mike and Johnny showed us around and hiked to the falls with us. I would recommend Red Dolphin cruises to anyone staying in the Puerto Vallarta area.

469684106.name: What a day!
469684106.author: a TripAdvisor user
469684106.reviewBody: Had a marvelous day with Captain Mike and Michelle.  Saw Rays and many humpback whales frolicking.  Would recommend this excursion highly.  Thanks Mike and Michelle.  The marg\'s were among the best i\'ve had.

466883843.name: Fantastic Day!!!
466883843.author: a TripAdvisor user
466883843.reviewBody: We had a fantastic day out with Captain Mike, Michelle and First Mate Johnny! The boat is very clean and safe! We had a great day watching the whales and mataray\'s cruise around and put on a show!\nThe crew were very accommodating to all guests on board including our 4 year old! \nIf you get the chance have a day out with Mike and crew, it is fantastic!

465520589.name: Great day .
465520589.author: a TripAdvisor user
465520589.reviewBody: We took our family out to see the whales, very accommodating with a 4 year old and a 10 year old.  Mike the captain is a great sailor, and his team of two provide great service and are very mindful of everyone\'s safety on the boat.  Boat is very clean. Lunch and snacks were really good. Kids had a great time sailing and helping Mike drive the boat home! Thanks for the great day Mike , and hold onto that staff you have, they are "perfect".

462830429.name: Second Amazing Trip
462830429.author: a TripAdvisor user
462830429.reviewBody:
